loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq is a 24-year-old refugee. He is married, has 2 sons, and he and his family live in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) settlement. 

Tofiq has been growing and selling seasonal fruit at the local bazaar for 8 years. He has good experience in this field, and his monthly income is 150 AZN.

The Azerbaijani people like to eat fresh fruit. They prepare not only fresh fruit juices, but also different sorts of jams, which they like to eat especially during tea time. Local people frequent Tofiq’s stand because his fruit is always fresh and tasty.

However, Tofiq doesn’t earn enough money to cover his family’s needs. He has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy new fruit tree seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, Tofiq would like to grow vegetables in order to diversify his assortment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and new seeds for fruit trees.

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 28 years old and married with four kids. She and other members of her family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. Her husband is laborer and gets additional earnings for the family. The main source of income for her family is gardening. She raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them at a local bazaar. She has gained good skills working in this field for six years. Her monthly income is 240AZN.

Local people have high demands for food, especially fresh fruits and vegetables. They visit the local bazaar every day and attend Sevinc’s greengrocery every morning. They know that Sevinc doesn’t use pesticides when growing fruits and vegetables.

Sevinc’s family settled in the IDP settlement recently and they need to build their house. Unfortunately, her monthly income isn’t enough to do this. She applied for 1500AZN in order to buy new fertilizers for her garden.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers for her garden.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Valeria es madre soltera de un hijo y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler, al menos vive de manera decente en el lugar Valeria se dedica al comercio de edredones, ella no los fabrica solo los vende, también trabaja como promotora de productos ESIKA (cosmeticos) Como ya se acerca la navidad, Valeria quiere un credito para comprar productos de temporada (cosmeticos, edredones y otros) y poder incrementar sus ingresos Valeria es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y ha hecho buenos calculos para tener exito en navidad
texts.en:
Valeria is the single mother of one son.  She lives respectably in La Paz in a rented house made of brick and cement. Valeria works selling quilts.  She does not make them, but only sells them.  She also works doing ESIKA cosmetics sales.  

Since Christmas is approaching, Valeria is requesting a loan to purchase seasonal products (cosmetics, quilts, and other items) to be able to increase her profits.  Valeria is the only source of income for her household but she enjoys good health and has planned carefully to have success in the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal products (cosmetics, quilts, and other items).

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Garnahovit village in the Aragatsotn region. She lives with her husband, son and daughter. Hasmik and her husband work at the village local school. Both of them work hard to be able to earn a living for the family. Their salaries, however, are very low, and it is almost impossible to cover the growing needs of the family based on those salaries alone. To be able to take care of her family’s needs, Hasmik is extensively engaged in agribusiness; she keeps cows, sheep, pigs, piglets and calves, and she also cultivates wheat and potatoes. 

To sustain her agribusiness, Hasmik currently needs a loan of $1,500 USD to purchase forage and seeds for land cultivation. Hasmik and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful to them for the support.

loans.use: to pay for forage and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Al- Tamoil Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Tamoil. It consists of four ladies and a man who live in Taiz city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 340,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Amal is a hardworking woman. She is  28 years old and a married woman who lives with her family in miserable conditions in Taiz city.  She is the leader of the group. Amal is a very dynamic and active woman. She started her business of selling women's clothes and accessories door-to-door one year and a half ago. She started her business with a small amount of capital. Year by year, her business has improved more, but most of what she earns in profits goes to the expenses of her family. She has good experience in this business. 

Unfortunately, her income is not enough to enlarge her business more, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a variety of stylish and new women's clothes and accessories to resell to her customers.

Amal looks forward to expanding her business more, and she hopes to build a second floor of her house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of stylish and new women's clothes and accessories to resell

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, 37, is a smallholder farmer residing in Kericho, an agricultural town in the south Rift region of Kenya. He is among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Tomatoes are Erick’s flagship produce. He also practices tea leaf farming and does other small activities in order to supplement the meager income he earns. 

Back in 2000, Erick practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was raising a maize crop of only half an acre per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for his survival. He kept up with maize farming for years without turning a profit, until 2012 when he switched to tomato farming, and then there was light at the end of the tunnel for Erick. 

Today, Erick is a fully-fledged entrepreneur. He has been provided with technical guidance, training programs, and exposure visits. 

To capitalize more on his returns from the booming tomato farming, Erick is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES in order to build a greenhouse. Unlike his competition, Erick conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, he has created a name for himself and a demand for his produce. 

Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Erick's goal, which is to expand the greenhouse. In the future, he is also planning to introduce the zero-grazing method, intensify his maize farming, and start making value-added products.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: 5 son los hijos de la señora Luz, los cuales son muy jóvenes 24, 22, 20, 14, 14 las edades de sus muchachos que viven con ella y depende económicamente de ella, ha podido levantarlos gracias a su negocio de cría de ganado bovino en pocas palabras es productora de leche y en vista del bajo costo que tiene el litro de leche Luz, necesito producir más para abarcar los gastos de su hogar por tal razón solicita un crédito para la compra de 3 vacas lecheras, con lo que aumentara su productividad a tal punto de tener como pagar las cuotas del crédito solicitado y responder por los gasto del hogar, siendo pagar los gastos de estudios de todos sus  hijos su mayor ambición.
texts.en: Luz has five children, who are 24, 22, 20, 14, and 14 years old.  They live with her and depend on her financially.  She has been able to raise them thanks to her business raising cows.  They produce milk and due to the low cost of a liter of milk, Luz needs to produce more to cover her household expenses.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase three diary cows to increase her productivity.  This will allow her to make her loan repayments and take care of her household expenses, including the cost of sending her children to school, which is her biggest ambition.

loans.use: to purchase three dairy cows since she wants to have resources to pay for her children's education and to make her repayments on time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram is 47 years old, married, and has three kids. His family are refugees and they have lived in an IDP (internally displaced persons) settlement for a long time. Bayram is a farmer; he raises fruits (apples, pears, etc.) and vegetables (cucumbers, onions, potatoes, greens) and then sells them at the local bazaar. He has worked in this field for 14 years, and his monthly salary is 220 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

People like eating fruits and vegetables. They know that fresh fruits and vegetables are useful for health. They use fruits to prepare juice or jam and cook different kinds of soups and dishes using vegetables. They prefer buying fruits and vegetables from private gardens because it’s cheaper. 

Bayram doesn’t earn enough money to cover his big family’s demands. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers and new sorts of fruit tree seeds. He wants to provide a good education for his children and make their lives as easy as possible.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and new sorts of fruit tree seeds

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 20-year-old, ambitious young man living in Ajloun, Jordan, with his family. He is a university stduent majoring in design, and he is in his third year. His aim is to work in his field after graduating to start depending on himself and to support his family financially after the financial crisis they have been facing. 

Now he is asking for your help by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Holiskhon

texts.ru: Холисхон 58 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. У Холисхон среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 20 лет занимается полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Холисхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 0,63 ГА, где она выращивает картофель, капусту, кукурузу для реализации оптовым покупателям. Экологически чистые и очень вкусные овощи пользуются большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Холисхон составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, часть средств будет направлена на приобретение арматуры и клеенки для парника. Доходы от кредита Холисхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она хочет построить большую теплицу.
texts.en: Holiskhon is 58 years old, a widow, and the mother of four. Holiskhon has received secondary education. She is retired. As a supplementary source of income for her family, Holiskhon has been growing farm produce for some 20 years. Thanks to Holiskhon's persistence and hard work, her farm at present includes a land plot of 0.63 ha [1.5 acres], where she grows potatoes, cabbage and corn to sell to wholesale buyers. Her vegetables, organically grown and very tasty, are in high demand. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, she has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 130,000 KGS to buy seeds. Part of these funds will be used to buy frame reinforcements and plastic film for her greenhouse. Holiskhon plans to invest her revenue in an additional expansion as her farms. She would like to build a large greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase seeds as well as frame reinforcements and plastic film for greenhouses in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura, 48, is married with a daughter and a son. The family are all internally displaced persons (IDPs) and they live in an IDP settlement. She is a farmer, raising fruits (apples, pears, quince, and others) and vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, greens and so on) and then sells them at local bazaar. She has worked in this field for 15 years and her monthly income is 150 AZN.

People living in IDP settlements have high demands for fresh fruits and vegetables. They prepare different delicious dishes for their poor families. They buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens because products there are cheaper than in usual markets.

Safura doesn’t earn enough money to cover her family’s demands. She applied for a loan of 1500 AZN in order to buy new fertilizers and increase her harvest. She hopes that one day she will be able to provide her children with a good education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and increase her harvest

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en:
Omer is a 24-year-old man who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He works hard to provide a good life for his family. He has been working in the business of phone accessories for two years. Omer has a lot of time to dedicate to his business, and many people prefer his business and goods because he is an honest and hardworking young man. He has many ideas for his business that he’s been implementing little by little. He is a very professional and confident young man and his customers give him good references. 

Lately, he has been thinking of providing his store with a bigger variety of products in order to attract more customers and to meet their demands. This idea was the impetus to request a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a variety of products for his store, such as phone accessories, that would bring in more customers. Omer looks forward to providing his business with more items to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for his store, such as phone accessories, that would bring in more customers.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is a 37-year-old lady living in Irbid, Jordan. She has recently started studying for a master's with the major of education management. Her aim is to improve her experience in life and to find a job with a good salary after graduating. 

Now she has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam is a 20-year-old single lady living with her family that consists of eleven members in Mafraq, Jordan. Her father is a retired man. Living with a big family has made her parents face a financial crisis, which pushes her to study harder in order to work in her field after getting her bachelor's. She is now asking for you to help pay for her upcoming semester fees by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Blema Tesa Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of the Blema Tesa group from Teshie, Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of three members who earn their living by selling groceries, kente and linen. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. 

Elaine is a 57-year-old single woman and has a dependent child. She completed six years of formal education, but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Elaine is engaged in the selling of kente (Ghanaian traditional cloth). She is applying for her sixth loan with ID Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase more kente to sell to her customers. 

On behalf of her colleagues, Elaine expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: to purchase more kente (traditional cloth) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca tiene un Autoservice bien surtido donde atiende todos los días de la semana, tiene buen movimiento de clientes teniendo en cuenta la buena ubicación de su negocio.Su marido es constructor de obras, y en su tiempo libre le ayuda a doña Blanca en su negocio, es una pareja que se ayuda y que quiere salir adelante.
El préstamo lo pide para la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su autoservice con bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca has a well-stocked self-service store that she manages every day of the week. She has a good flow of customers since her business is in a good location. Her husband is a builder and helps Doña Blanca with the business in his free time. This couple helps one another because they want to get ahead.

The loan that Blanca is requesting will be used to buy various products to restock her self-service store. She will buy beverages, food products, vegetables, fruits, and other items.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food products, vegetables, fruits, and other items for her self-service store.

loans.name: Agapi

texts.en:
This young woman is Agapi from Zovasar village. She is an agronomist and lives with her mother-in-law and two little daughters. Agapi's husband and father-in-law are migrant workers.

To take care of their needs, Agapi and her mother-in-law are extensively engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in cattle breeding, and in the cultivation of grass. 

Agapi sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Agapi needs to make some investments. A loan of 1,500 USD will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family and will enable her to purchase her winter supply of forage for the cattle.
 
Agapi and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter

loans.name: Aleta

texts.en:
This kind woman in the picture is Aleta from Sisian. She lives there with her husband and retired mother-in-law. Her husband works in auto repair service. To take care of her family, Aleta is engaged in beekeeping and in cultivation of haricots, potatoes and some fruit trees. With the help of her mother-in-law, Aleta sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustained way, Aleta needs a loan of $2,000 to purchase 20 colonies of bees. As this is Aleta's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Aleta and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for 20 colonies of bees

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 24 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a general store in South Sudan for the past six years.

Joy has requested a 1700 South Sudanese pound loan through Women & Youth Empowerment (WOYE) Microfinance Institution to purchase additional grocery items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, noodles, etc., to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Dairy farming has always played a core role in East Africa. The predominant type of dairy farming, traditional subsistence farming, is done mainly on a small scale for survival. Samwel has kept dairy animals for 15 years on his farm in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. 

Since Samwel had children, his personal and financial obligations have skyrocketed. He has different ways to make money, but keeps coming up short. He decided the best way to grow economically was to improve his farm's productivity. To increase milk production, he could either buy more cows or replace the existing cows with more productive breeds. The latter makes more economic sense. Traditional breeds are well-adjusted to the environmental conditions and disease-resistant, but their milk production is very low. Cross-breeds and Friesians are more productive, and can survive in the same environment as the traditional breeds, but they come at a price. 

Samwel is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a productive dairy cow that will bring him more income. He will use the additional income to pay for his children's education and to meet family expenses. His future plan is to keep growing his income-generating asset base.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, eggs, coffee and milk sachets, and other groceries. 

Estrella has requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, cigarettes, beverages, etc. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, milk, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is married and lives with his wife and children. He pays a large portion of the family's expenses. 

His work is to repair motorcycles  and sell spare parts to his customers. Through this income he can pay school fees for his children and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more accessories and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is 53 years old. 24 years ago, he decided to open a business so that he could support his family, which is comprised of his wife and five children. He works together with his two assistants in a small cafeteria which he built through hard work and sacrifice. His business is well known due to its strategic location and good service.

Vahid 's biggest dream is to expand his business so that he can serve more customers. He is satisfied with his business and his profits come to 150 AZN a month. He is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN to repair his café and buy new furniture. He has taken out and repaid a previous loan from Aqroinvest. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support

loans.use: to repair his café and buy new furniture.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 55 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Rosalia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, toothpaste, dried fish, eggs, soap powder, vinegar, soy sauce, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a thirty-eight-year male, married with three children and living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He is a farmer growing crops such as maize, cotton, tomatoes, and cassava. Stephen is a hard working man with a dream of expanding his agriculture business; however, he is faced with a challenge of floods and too much sunshine that destroy his crops. 

Stephen wants money to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 22-year-old young woman from the village of Sairkhe. She lives with her parents, brother and sister-in-law. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income to even cover their basic needs. For the above-mentioned situation, Maka's father gets social assistance from the local government. Maka is divorced and does everything for her family's welfare. She has a high education, but in spite of this she has been unable to find a stable job. So she started working as a sales lady at the local store. She generates 200 GEL per month and uses it to increase her family's living conditions. 

Maka has a great desire to begin an activity that will help her family reach a normal standard of living and become financially stable. She requested a loan from local financial institutions and was at last approved. The joint initiative between Kiva and Credo gives a chance for poor people to start or re-start businesses. 

Maka has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of an agricultural business. She will place the purchased calves in a cattle shed located in the family yard. She will raise them and, after 12 months, start milking them. Maka will do cheese production and sell it at the open market of the nearby town. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase by 200%. 

Maka and her family will be able to create better living conditions.

loans.use: to start an agribusiness by purchasing calves.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Hosea, Joseph and Shem. Hannatu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Hannatu expects to reap up to 30 bags per hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Hannatu to generate earnings of up to $1000 per hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Hannatu said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay her children's school fees, and make food and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Kenneth, from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, left his to become a full-time small holder farmer. He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. 

Kenneth is blessed with one lovely child who he refers to as “my heart beat.” His primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Kenneth was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Kenneth said. “It is in my blood.” 

For the past two years, Kenneth has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. 

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. 

With your loan, Kenneth is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Kenneth is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 36-year-old hardworking woman married to James, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Rose operates a retail business shop which has been in operation for three years, earning her an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy sugar, rice, tea leaves, and detergents to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Rose plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, tea leaves, rice, and detergents to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

loans.name: Om Hakim Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Hakim. It consists of five women and a man who are all hard working. They live in Taiz, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 260,000 YER. 

Hakima is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She is uneducated but very active and dynamic. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. The miserable condition of the family lead Hakima to decide to help her husband cover the necessary expenses. For this reason, Hakima started selling perfume and cosmetics door-to-door. 

Hakima strives to make a better future for her family. Most of what she earns goes to her family, and she wants to improve her business but she doesn't have enough money to do. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more perfume and cosmetics to attract a lot of customers.

Hakima looks forward to opening a savings account to provide her children with a safe future.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Stella

texts.es:
María es una madre cabeza de familia de 61 años de edad que logro mantener a sus 5 hijos gracias a la venta de productos pro catalogo una actividad que una amiga le enseño y gracias a esto pudo darle el sustento a sus 5 hijos. 
Para María este negocio lo es todo y es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía de catálogo como ropa, productos de belleza, decoración, y producto de uso personal puesto que tiene unos encargos que cubrir y necesita el capital para comprar los productos directamente y tener una mejor ganancia.
Para María este apoyo es muy importante subirá su moral y le dará más ganas de seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar las condiciones de su hogar pues es una mujer cabeza de familia que en su juventud lo dio todo pro sus hijos y ya que están grandes quiere darse algo para ella.
texts.en:
Maria is a female head of family, a woman of 61 years old who has managed to support her 5 children thanks to catalogue product sales, a line of work that her friend taught her and thanks to that, she has been able to provide for her 5 children.

For Maria, this business is everything and that is is why she is requesting a loan to buy catalogue merchandise such as clothing, beauty products, decor and products for personal use, as she has some costs to cover and needs the funds to purchase products directly and have a better income.

For Maria, this support is very important. It will raise her morale and give her more desire to continue working and struggling for better conditions for her home as she is a female head of the family who in her youth gave everything to her family as they are already grown and want to give something to her.

loans.use: to buy products from catalogues.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana works in a grocery store. She sells staple items such as rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She works from 8:00 a.m to 7:00 p.m. 

She has been in this business for five years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. 

Juana is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She is happy about the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
La socia  Maria Nelly  se dedica al negocio confecciones como pantalones, faldas, vestidos, pantalones y blusas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 40 años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de costurera. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telas, tijeras e hilos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Nelly has  a sewing business  making pants, skirts, dresses, and blouses. She works from 8 AM until 6 PM and has  40 years in this business already. Her dream is to expand her sewing business. 

She is requesting the loan in order to buy fabric, scissors and thread. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy fabric, scissors and thread.

loans.name: Nelly Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Nelly Florencia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vinos y licores, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de vinos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar vinos. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nelly Florencia continues running her business selling wine and liquor. She wants to get ahead through this work. Her dream is to expand her wine sales business. She is requesting the loan to buy wine. She is happy about the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy wine

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 47 years. She is married to Mohammed and together they have been blessed with five children. She sells fish, a business she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000.

Halima has requested  a loan of KES 30,000 which she will use to add fresh stock of fish for drying and selling. She enjoys doing this business and as a result she always makes profits. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan, as well as continue adding stock of fish.

This is Halima's second loan with VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life.

loans.use: to add fresh stock of fish for selling

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school, so she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc..

Herminia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara is an experienced farmer from Spitak city in the Lori region. She lives with her 8-year-old son. Her husband is a migrant worker, who left his family to find a well-paid job and sustain their living.

Nara is the main breadwinner of the family. To be able to cover those needs, Nara is engaged in breeding livestock (a cow, calves, hens, and a pig),  and in the cultivation of wheat and fruit trees. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of the family's income.  

Nara currently needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustained way. She needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a cow. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Nara was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Nara  relies on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for helping the family to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pliers, tweezers and replacement parts for watches such as straps, hands, protectors, batteries, etc. for her watch repair shop.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman, aged 34 years, with three children aged 11, 6, and 1 years; two children attend different schools. She lives with her family in a rural set-up. She owns a wholesale business in Kyotera town and she works for 7 days a week and 13 hours a day.

She is also a farmer from where she gets an additional income to support her family and she has been a farmer since 2010. She was motivated by the profitability of the business. She hopes to use the loan to boost her wholesale business by re-stocking more goods since it’s near Christmas season and sheusually sells her goods to local people from Kyotera town and surrounding areas.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate all her children and to enlarge her business. She does, however, face a challenge of limited capital which affects her operations.

She is described as an honest and shrewd woman in business and she appreciates the services offered to her.

loans.use: to buy  merchandise in bulk (sugar, salt, cooking oil, corn flour, etc.)

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
Dromo is a group of three ladies. They all live in Accra-Teshie, Ghana. They are asking for a loan of GHS 2,600 from ID Ghana to sell ready-made dresses, eggs, kids wear, groceries, slippers and underwear. 

Esther is a 44-year-old single woman with two children. She has been selling groceries and ready-made dresses for five years. She takes care of the children by herself by selling goods from her residence. She wants to improve her business though, as most of what she earns goes to family expenses. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of GHS 1,100 from ID Ghana in order to buy more eggs, ready-made dresses and groceries which she will sell to her customers. 

Esther will save part of her profits and also invest some of it after she finishes repaying her loan.

loans.use: to buy more eggs, ready-made dresses and groceries which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia Fanny se sigue dedicando al trabajo como asesora juridica,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su consultorio juridico.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar escritorio para su consultorio jurídico.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny continues working as a legal advisor. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her legal practice. She is requesting the loan to buy a desk for her legal office. 

She is happy about the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy a desk for her legal office

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° año de bachillerato, está acompañada. Su pareja trabaja la agricultura y con ganado. Tiene dos hijos que viven en su casa con ella y uno estudia. Además viven dos nietos con ella pero no dependen de ella. María se dedica a la venta de ropa y de cosméticos, lo ha hecho por 4 años, lo aprendió por motivación de una amiga y decidió hacerlo porque siempre ha trabajado con negocio. Antes tenía una tienda y venta de pupusas. Viaja en bus para salir a vender la mercaderia, le apoya su compañero de vida. Su horario es de 8:00 am a 11:30 am y algunas veces por la tarde. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ropa y cosméticos por mayoreo, le mejorará su negocio con el préstamo porque podrá ofrecer a sus clientes diferentes productos y así mismo le generará mayor ganancia. La necesidad satisfecha es que a través del préstamo tiene la oportunidad de seguir trabajando. 

Sus sueños son poder tener muchos clientes para trabajar más fuerte para darle estudio superior a su hijo. El préstamo le ayudará mucho porque tiene la oportunidad de trabajar y con las ganancias ir pagando y así responder muy bien a Credicampo para tener la oportunidad que le siga prestando.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old, she studied up to the 2nd year of high school, she is in a relationship. Her partner works in agriculture and with cattle. She has two children who live at home with her, and one goes to school. Also two grandchildren live with her but they are not dependent on her. 

Maria works selling clothing and cosmetics, she has done this for 4 years. She learnt it through the motivation of a friend and decided to do the work because she had always worked in business. Before she had a shop and sold pupusas. She takes the bus to go out and sell her merchandise, her husband husband supports her. Her hours are 8am to 11:30am and sometimes in the afternoons.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase clothing and cosmetics wholesale, she will improve her business with the loan because she will be able to offer her customers different products and this will generate more income. The need that will be met is that through the loan she has the opportunity to continue working.

Her dreams are to be able to have a lot of customers in order to work even harder to give a better education to her son. The loan will help her a lot because she has the opportunity to work and with the income be able to make payments and thus respond very well to CrediCampo to have the opportunity to continue borrowing.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is an experienced young farmer from Gegharot village. She lives with her husband and three sons (15, 11 and 9 years old). To take care of her family, Karine and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, and cultivation of potatoes. Her husband and sons assist her greatly in her daily activities related to farming.  They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the family's main source of income. Karine's husband is a village herdsman.
 
To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Karine needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase two calves and forage (barley) for feeding the livestock in the winter season. The loan will help her run her agribusiness in a productive way. Karine and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the requested loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage (barley) for feeding the livestock in the winter season

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 64 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for three years. Her current monthly income is KES 8,000.
 
She will be using this loan to buy more stock of chickens to raise. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her farming, make more income and educate her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Her name is Divina, 29, and she is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines, married to Garry, a tricycle driver and has two kids. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs.

Divina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also has a tricycle unit for transport service, which her husband drives for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 500 a day. 

To help her expand her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, sugar, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. Part of the loan will be used to repair her tricycle unit. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are her source to meet the daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Divina hopes to maintain and grow her business so she can have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell and to repair her tricycle

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 41 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school, Tessie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a rice vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old married man with one child who is 13 years old. He is a farmer who grows passion fruit, bananas, beans, and coffee to sell.
 
He also deals in the produce business as an additional source of income and has been a farmer for many years now. He was motivated by the desire to earn a living and the fact that it did not require a lot of capital. He hopes to use the loan to buy fertilizers for his plantations, which he thinks will boost his yields and earning in the long run. He usually sells his goods to fellow traders from surrounding areas.

His hope and dream is to be the leading producer of agricultural products around Kaswa and surrounding areas. However, he faces a challenge of limited capital, which affects his operations.

He is described as an honest and shrewd man in business.

loans.use: to buy organic manure,

loans.name: Essenam  Amélé

texts.fr:
Essénam est une jeune veuve de 32 ans. Elle habite le quartier Dabadakondji avec son enfant. Elle a débuté en 2003,  elle vend des bracelets, des colliers et des boucles d’oreilles.
Pour satisfaire les besoins permanents de sa clientèle et diversifier ses produits, Essenam sollicite un crédit pour acheter 05 colliers faits de perles,  03 douzaines de boucle d’oreilles et une douzaine de colliers plaqués or. Ce crédit lui permettra également d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Essénam is a young widow who is 32 years old. She lives in the Dabadakondji neighborhood with her child.

In 2003, she started selling bracelets, necklaces, and earrings. In order to meet the needs of her clients and diversify the products she sells, Essénam is asking for a loan to buy five beaded necklaces, three dozen pairs of earrings, and one dozen gold-plated necklaces. This credit will also allow her to increase her revenue.

loans.use: buy five beaded necklaces, three dozen pairs of earrings, and one dozen chain necklaces.

loans.name: Jappo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le GIE JAPPO 1 a comme président Magueye. Il est âgé de 50ans, marié et père de famille. Le GIE est composé de 5 personnes qui sont toutes dans le même quartier et qui font généralement  la même activité.  Et ils font des rencontres mensuels pour lutter contre leur pauvreté et tenir leur destin en main. Le président évolue dans la commercialisation des  moutons et des chèvres. Il gère tous les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il demande ce montant pour acheter des moutons, les engraisser pour ensuite les revendre. Il  a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, il voudrait  augmenter son cheptel et diversifier ses produits afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses commandes et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi il pourra  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Magueye is the president of the Gie Jappo 1 group. He is 50 years old, married, and a father. The group is comprised of five people who all live in the same neighborhood and work in similar businesses. They have monthly meetings to combat poverty and take control of their own destiny. 

The president sells sheep and goats. He manages his family's daily expenses including his children's schooling fees. He is asking for this amount to buy sheep and fatten them for resale. He has more than five years experience in this business. He starts his day at 8 am and ends his day at 7 pm. 

In the future, he would like to have more livestock and diversify his products so that he can satisfy orders and increase his revenues. He would like to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy sheep and goats to resell in the market.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and has six children, two of whom are in school.  Elvira is married.

Elvira is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Elvira has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old university student majoring in finance, and he is in his third year. He is planning to find a job with a good income after getting his bachelor's degree so that he can support himself. Because he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old. She is married to Esmond and together they have been blessed with two children, ages 12 and 5. Esmond earns additional income for the family. Agnes runs a grocery store, a business she has been doing for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

Agnes has requested a loan of 15,000 KES, which she will use to add stock of assorted vegetables and other groceries. With the anticipated profits, Agnes will be able to pay school fees for her children and provide for the basic needs of her family. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loans.

Agnes hopes and dreams of taking care of her family's basic and secondary needs.

loans.use: to add stock of assorted vegetables and other groceries

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has a retail shop in Kisumu. She has been running this business for 10 years now, and it has been profitable. She is 38 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with five children. She makes a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of flour, rice and cooking oil to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to have a prosperous and successful business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: Nelli is from Gegharot village. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and little son. Her husband works as a farmer in the village doing hired sowing work using his own tractor. Both of them work hard to be able to make ends meet. With the help of her husband, Nelli is engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of barley and potatoes. As the family’s needs are growing day by day, Nelli wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to meet her family's increasing needs. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great help to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling them to purchase four new tires for the tractor. Nelli and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for their support in providing the needed loan.

loans.use: to pay for four new tires for the tractor

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a married woman with twelve children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gertrudes is 57 years old.

Gertrudes has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing. Gertrudes has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 27-year-old mother of two from Mundri County in South Sudan. Mary operates her own business. She buys and sells grocery items such as sugar and cooks tea and sells it.

Mary is requesting a loan from WOYE MFI so that she can expand her business. She will be able to increase her stock and boost her business to hotel management. Mary hopes to build her own hotel in the community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, tea spices and milk for her customers

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Florencia is 54 years old and two of her children are in school.

Florencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials for fishing .

Florencia has been in this business for 30 years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, at 31 years old, is a charismatic, ever-smiling, active and attentive man. 

He is happily married and blessed with two angels looking like children. Being still young and full of energy, he has been practicing farming for the past five years, and has been making profits. His farming involves feeding and attending to his animals. His primary source of income is selling eggs, maize, vegetables and some small business he does to make ends meet. When asked what’s the most enjoyable bit about farming he answered, “I get food to eat and to sell”. Evans has extensive land and has planted enough Napier grass. He has always wanted to buy a good dairy breed of cow, but the challenge he has been facing is a lack of finances. That is why he is seeking funds to make his dream a reality. Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, he will make his dream a reality because these institutions are all about helping small-scale farmers better their livelihood. He underwent training with Juhudi Kilimo and has learned that microfinance helps the poor access financing and helps them in their projects. He says that through the loan, he will increase his milk production and therefore increase his income level. Profits from the loan will be used to repay the loan and secure the future of his young family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 27-year-old university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his third year. He is a self-dependent man who also works in the evening as a cashier in a mall. Mohammad is aiming to get his Bachelor's degree so that he can find a better job with a better income. As he does not have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his study fees.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 45 years old and has five children. Leonora is a married woman and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonora has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this activity. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en: Because Rehab is a conservative lady, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Rehab is a 42-year-old married woman living in Zarqa, Jordan with her family that consists of four members. Her husband is a retired man, and his pension is not enough to pay his children's study fees. Rehab wants to provide her children with the best education. One of her daughters is a university student majoring in Special Education, and she is in her third year. She is seeking to continue her studies and attain her Masters degree to start supporting her family financially. Rehab is now applying for this loan to help her daughter to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's study fees.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 39-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Moses is a farmer growing crops and rearing animals. He grows crops such as maize, tomatoes and cassava in addition to dairy farming. Moses has a dream of expanding his dairy farm however he is faced with a challenge of diseases such as foot-and-mouth disease. Moses is hard working and needs money to buy dairy cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows for his farm.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 31 años de edad, casada, tienes tres hijos de doce, siete y un año, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es fuerte, luchadora, responsable, buena madre y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad ‘Cachilaya’ un lugar caracterizado por su cercanía al lago Titicaca, donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la pesca y agricultura.
Lourdes es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, viste de forma típica (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Su trabajo es la pesca que realiza diariamente en el lago, esta práctica la efectúa dos veces al día. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que también se dedica a la pesca, y sus tres hijos; dos de los cuales asisten a la escuela, viven en una casa de adobe que cuenta con el servicio de luz y agua. Después de siete años de experiencia en la pesca, esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la empresa; debido a que el bote en el que trabajan se encuentra desgastado y no brinda la seguridad necesaria, tampoco se puede            reparar porque la madera esta dañada, la única solución es realizar la compra de un bote nuevo.
Su sueño es que sus hijos en el futuro accedan a alguna carrera profesional, y desea realizar la compra de un bote de pesca nuevo para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia y mejorar sus ingresos.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote de pesca que brinde seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 31 years old and has three children, ages twelve, seven and one. She has a fishing business.

Lourdes is strong, plucky, responsible, a good mother and very hard working. She works in the Cachilaya community, very close to Lake Titicaca, where the majority of inhabitants work in fishing and farming.

Lourdes is dark skinned and has long, dark, plaited hair. She is short and dresses in typical clothing - a blanket, jumper and hat). Lourdes' native language is Aymara but she also speaks Spanish for her business. 

Lourdes works in fishing. She works twice every day in the lake. She shares her life with her husband, who is also a fisherman, and her three children. Two of Lourdes' children are in school. The family lives in an adobe house that has both running water and electricity. 

With seven years experience in fishing, this is Lourdes' first loan. The boat that Lourdes uses in her work has deteriorated and is not safe enough to use. It cannot be repaired because the wood is damaged: the only solution is to buy a new boat.

Lourdes' dream is for her children to study a profession in the future. She wants to buy and new boat in order provide her family with more security and increase her income.

For these reasons Lourdes is applying for a loan in order to buy a fishing boat that will make her family safer.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat that will make her family safer.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits d'alimentation générale, Sophia sollicite un premier crédit. Le profit l'aidera à agrandir son stock et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge. Elle est âgée de 23ans.
texts.en:
In order to buy general foodstuffs, Sophia is seeking her first loan.

Profits will help her increase her stock and support her family's needs.

Sophia is 23 years old, married, and has two children under her care.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan est divorcée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle habite dans l’une des périphériques de Lomé, nommée Logogomé. Elle commercialise depuis 2008 le maïs et les tubercules. Elle s’approvisionne dans la ville d’Atakpamé auprès des fermiers et ensuite les revend en détail aux revendeuses de son quartier. 
Massan souhaite associer à son activité la vente de gombo sec en poudre. La transformation du gombo sec avec le mortier lui prend environ 03 heures de temps.
Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son stock en achetant 08 sacs de gombo.
texts.en:
Massan is divorced and a mother of one child. She is 43 years old. She lives on the outskirts of Lomé, in an area called Logogomé. 

Massan has been selling corn and tubers since 2008. She procures her goods in Atakpamé from farmers and then resells them at retail to resellers in her area. 

She wishes to start selling dried okra powder. Making dried okra into powder takes about three hours with a mortar. She is seeking a loan to increase her stock by buying eight sacs of okra.

loans.use: to buy eight sacs of dried okra

loans.name: Ayéléhomé

texts.fr: Afin de s'approvisionner en produits alimentaires et en chaussures pour revendre aux clients, Ayéléhomé fait un huitième crédit à WAGES. Elle s'approvisionne au Ghana et au pays pour revendre dans sa boutique louée à cet effet. Elle se fait par 01 personne et espère assurer le bien - être de la famille. Elle a 01 enfant de 07ans qui est scolarisé. Son conjoint est comptable. Ayéléhomé quant à elle est âgée de 33ans avec 10ans d'ancienneté dans l'activité.
texts.en:
In order to procure food products and shoes to resell to customers, Ayéléhomé is on her eighth loan with WAGES. She procures her goods in Ghana and in Togo and resells them in her shop that she rents. She does her work by herself and has 10 years' experience.

Ayéléhomé is 33 years old, married to an accountant, and has one 7-year-old child, who goes to school. 

She hopes to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and general food products

loans.name: Eya Blandine

texts.fr: Blandine a 29 ans et célibataire sans enfant. Elle loue une chambre dans le quartier de Dabadakondji. Depuis 2009, elle a commencé un commerce des sous vêtements. Mais suite à un déménagement, Blandine a débuté en 2010 la vente des mèches et tissages. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à cause de manque de fonds de roulement. Elle sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter  19 tissages et  20 mèches afin d’augmenter ses bénéfices et son stock.
texts.en:
Blandine is a 29-year-old single woman with no children. She rents a room in the Dabadakondji neighborhood. Since 2009, she has worked selling underwear. But then after a move in 2010, she started selling hair extensions and hair weaves.

She procures her goods once a week due to a lack of cash flow. She is seeking this micro-loan to buy 19 hair weaves and 20 hair extensions in order to increase her stock and earnings.

loans.use: to buy 20 hair extensions and 19 hair weaves

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Ayaba a 57 ans et demeure dans une chambre louée dans le quartier Djifa kpota adidomé.  Ayaba est très active, depuis 1990, elle vend à la criée dans des marchés des pagnes et seau plastique. Par manque de fonds de roulement suffisant, elle ravitaille son stock toutes les 02 semaines. Afin de réduire les frais de transport et augmenter son stock, elle sollicite un prêt pour diversifier les marques des pagnes. Les bénéfices lui permettront d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of one child, Ayaba is 57 years old and lives in a rented room in the Djifa Kpota Adidomé neighborhood. She is very active, and since 1990 she has worked auctioning pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and plastic buckets in the markets.

Due to a lack of cash flow, she restocks every two weeks. In order to reduce the costs of transport and to increase her stock, she is seeking a loan to diversify the types of pagnes that she sells.

Earnings will allow her to increase her sales and support her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy three lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Ronald Antonio

texts.es:
Ronald es un joven de 20 años, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos. 

 Ronald se dedica a trabajar la agricultura con su padre en los días libres, ya que siembran granos básicos para el consumo de la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para ampliar la casa y construir una habitación mas, para que su familia tenga una mejor comodidad.

El sueño de  Ronald es tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Ronald is a 20 year old young man who studied through high school.  He is single and lives with his parents and siblings.

Ronald works in agriculture with his father, and they plant basic grains for family consumption. 

He is requesting a loan in order to add on to his home and build an additional room so that his family will be more comfortable.  Ronald's dream is to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to add on to his home and build an additional room so that his family will be more comfortable.

loans.name: Sovetkan

texts.ru: Советкан 49 лет, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Советкан среднее образование, более 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Советкан, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 1,11 ГА собственного земельного надела и 2,0 ГА арендованного, где Советкан ежегодно выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 2 бычка, 18 овец и 1 лошадь. Она на ежедневной основе продает вкусное, экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Советкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков с целью дальнейшего разведения и реализации. Советкан намерена развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Sovetkan is 49 years old, married and has a grown son.  Sovetkan has a high-school education and for more than 20 years she has been growing crops and raising livestock.  Thanks to her hard and persistent work, she currently owns 1.11 hectares of land and rents 2 additional hectares.  She uses that land to grown wheat, rye, and saffron for use at her farm and for sale.  Also, she has two milk cows, two calves, two steers, 18 sheep and one horse. Everyday, Sovetkan is able to sell delicious and organic milk.  Her monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS).  To further grow her enterprise, Sovetkan turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase steers for fattening and resale.  Sovetkan plans to expand her business in order to save some money for the purchase a new apartment.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Rakhima

texts.ru: Рахима досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Рахимы есть 4 коровы, она по-прежнему выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Рахима хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого и вкусного домашнего молока и молочной продукции. Доходы от кредита Рахима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в расширение сарая для скота.
texts.en: Rakhima was able to pay her previous loan on time and use it for the intended purpose.  She thanks Kiva and all who helped her obtain that financing.  Today, she has 4 cows and continues to grow potatoes and corn.  Rakhima wants to grow her business further and so she turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase milk cows.  Having additional cows will allows her to sell more eco-friendly milk and other milk products.  Profits from her business, Rakhima wants to invest back into her enterprise by purchasing additional livestock and to expand her barn.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to sell more eco-friendly milk and other milk products

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Agée de 29 ans, Akossiwa est une jeune femme mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite le quartier Adakpamé à Lomé et offre le service de pédicure et de manucure à ses clients. C’est un service de porte à porte que fait Akossiwa depuis 2009. Elle parcourt plus de 6 kilomètres à pieds par jours. Fatiguée par la marche, Akossiwa a démarré en 2013, le commerce de chaussure dans son quartier.
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 3 douzaines de tapettes et 9 unités de chaussures d’adulte. Le revenue de cette activité lui permettra d’augmenter son épargne afin de pouvoir faire face aux dépenses futur de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a young woman of 29 years of age. She is married with three children.
She lives in the Adakpamé district of Lome and provides pedicure and manicure services for her clients. This is a door-to-door service that Akossiwa has been doing since 2009. She walks a distance of over six kilometers a day. Tired by walking so far, she started up a business selling shoes in her neighbourhood in 2013.
She requests a loan to buy three dozen fly swats and nine pairs of adult–sized shoes. The income from this activity will enable her to increase her savings to cope with future expenses for her family.

loans.use: to buy nine pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Depuis 2011, Kodjo a ouvert son cybercafé pour rendre service à ceux qui n'ont pas d'internet à domicile. Dans son cybercafé, il répare aussi des portables. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des ordinateurs et accessoires informatiques. Il souhaite à l'avenir, avoir un grand cyber et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale. Il est âgé de 28ans.
texts.en: Kodjo opened his internet café at his home in 2011, to provide service to people who do not have the internet in the home. At his internet cafe he also repairs portable telephones. To improve his business, he requests a second loan to buy computers and computer accessories. In the future he hopes to have a big internet cafe and later, get married. He is 28 years old.

loans.use: to buy computers and accessories.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a 25-year-old married female with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She deals in the salon business; she also does farming for additional income. Jovia hopes to expand her business. However, she lacks enough capital, which is her biggest challenge. 

Jovia is a hardworking woman who is accessing a loan to buy a dryer and chairs for the salon. She appreciates the services rendered.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and chairs for the salon.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is an ambitious man, and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of horticulture products. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. Frankline is a 21-year-old father of three who lives in the Kericho area, which is located in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. 

He has farmed for five years, and earns an honest and decent income. Frankline has both crops and a dairy farm, and has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Frankline. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. 

Frankline seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. Frankline and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. 

Frankline is disciplined regarding finances, and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income and a obtain a stable future for his family.

loans.use: To venture into other areas of farming

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 42 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Leonora has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gasoline to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for three years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 19-year-old married woman. She has been trying her best to support her husband in improving their living conditions. Maram has been selling clothes for one year. This business was profitable to her, and she is aiming to expand it. 

Now she decided to purchase blankets that her customers are requested for the upcoming winter season, and because she doesn’t have enough money to do so, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To purchase blankets to sell

loans.name: Vardush

texts.en:
Vardush is an experienced agronomist from Agarakadzor village. She lives with her son and her husband. To take care of her family's needs, she keeps sheep and hens. 

Vardush's husband assists her greatly during her daily farming activities. They take their produce to the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. To continue running her business in a sustainable way, Vardush needs a loan of $3,000 USD to buy 16 sheep and feed for them. The loan will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, making their business more sustainable. Vardush and her family are relying on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support to maintain and develop their business.

loans.use: to pay for 16 sheep and feed for them

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 41-year-old woman, from the village of Zarati. She lives with the parents, who get a pension from the local government. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, having no source of significant income for covering even basic needs. Maia has a high education, but in spite of this she was unable to find any stable job. 

Maia has a great desire to start an activity that will help her family to achieve normal living conditions, and become financially stability. Maia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting an agribusiness, but was not successful. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

At last she was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that gives a chance to poor people to start or re-start businesses. She will place the purchased calves in a cattle-shed located in the family yard. She will raise them and, after 12 months, will start milking them. Maia will start the production of cheese, and she will sell it at the open market of the nearby town. 

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase by 200%. Maia and her family will be able to create better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and start an agribusiness

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 32 years. She is married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children, ages 15, 14 and 12 years. Her spouse is employed, hence provides additional income for the family.
