Blanca, administra un negocio el cual consiste en atender una tienda y elaborar venta de tamales, el cual fue fundado hace 12 años, trabaja todos los días, la venta de tamales la realiza todas tardes; viven con su esposo de 43 años de edad y sus hijos, todos trabajan juntos y subsisten con los ingresos que genera el negocio.
Invertirá en elote, granos básicos, aceite, gallinas indias, bebidas, golosinas, etc., tendrá un mejor inventario para atraer nuevos clientes, tener una mejor rentabilidad y cumplir con sus compromisos.
Sus proyectos son tener una casa propia para que sus hijos tengan un mejor entorno.
texts.en:
Blanca runs a business which is a store. She also makes and sells tamales. She started it 12 years ago and works every day. She sells the tamales every afternoon. She lives with her husband, who is 43, and their children. All of them work together and subsist on the income that the business brings in. 

She will invest in corn, basic grains, oil, free range chickens, beverages, candies, etc. She will have better inventory to attract new customers, have more profitability, and to meet her commitments. 

Her projects are to have his own house so her children can have a better environment.

loans.use: to invest in corn, basic grains, oil, free range hens, beverages, candies, etc. to have better inventory to attract new customers.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her two children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, he has been running his own perfumes shop for many years. 

Alia's husband wants to purchase different types of perfumes to sell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these perfumes for his retail business. Therefore, Alia has applied for a  Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase perfumes for his business so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Alia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy perfumes from wholesaler for her husband's retail business.

loans.name: Sedana Ayu Group

texts.en:
With the current loan, Ni Nengah purchased two local piglets. When the payment time came, she sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She is really happy for that because during the period, her pigs grew well away from diseases, and she sold them at a high price. The profit fulfills her daily life and supports the capital for her business. 

She’s very grateful to MUK and Kiva lenders for supporting her business. She said she will always need assistance from the Loan Officer of MUK to give advice and solutions for her business.

In order to further enhance earnings in the field of breeding pigs, Ni Nengah and the whole group of Sedana Ayu continue to borrow the same amount from MUK. They are very satisfied with the services provided, so they agreed to develop this business. 

Besides being a pig farmer, Ni Nengah, also has a business as a chips maker. She makes many types of chips and sells them to the salesman who come to her house. 

Now, Ni Nengah already has two twelve month-old pigs and five piglets, and she will use the loan to buy super-quality feed and ingredients such as powder, oil and seasonings to make chips. Ni Nengah still expects assistance from MUK as business consultants. Profits will be saved for future needs.

In the meeting shown, one member couldn't attended because of illness.

loans.use: to buy super-quality feed and ingredients to make chips

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is a merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. Rocelyn sells various types of goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Rocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and others. This will enable her to augment her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store.

Rocelyn hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and condiments.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Erna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erna has been farming vegetables for 6 years and also earns additional income from fish-vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is 31 years old and with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall.

Gelyn has been in this business for 10 years. Gelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. Gina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Thomas, who lives in Kenyenya area of Kenya, also known as the banana region because of it produces the highest quality bananas in the world. Thomas is the father of four lovely children and has been doing farming for the past twelve years. 

Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, he has been able to produce milk and eggs. Thomas is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, he is able to take care of his family’s needs and wants. Although he experiences challenges in farming, his attitude keeps him going. Enjoying what he does, he has even nicknamed his cow “lovii.” 

Thomas is seeking a 20,000 KES loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage. This assists the animal in digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. With the loan, he will be able to increase his milk productivity and also increase his income levels, hence reducing the poverty level that is currently facing him. 

Thomas' biggest dream is to get out of this poverty level, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of his family and increasing his income level.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 50 years old and a father of 3 children. He is a hard-working man and a cattle dealer. He earns extra income from farming and motorcycle transport commonly known as boda boda business. 

His dreams are educating his children and buying his own motorcycle. However he is faced with a challenge of lack of capital. 

Adolf wants a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 37 years old and a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a butcher by profession, he sells beef, mutton, etc. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shamim's husband needs to purchase different types of cutting tools and cattle to get meat to sell so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase cattle and other accessories for his business. Therefore, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy meat and other cutting tools and accessories for her husband's butcher's shop.

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar is aged 38. She is the mother of three children. Her son owns a shop in which he sells electrical goods. He provides services to his clients for the maintenance of electric goods also. 

For the growth of his business and the desire to generate maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods to resell. Therefore, Kousar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc. to offer to his customers.

Kousar hopes that her son will be able to grow his business soon. She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's electrical goods shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Douen

texts.en:
Douen, a 31-year-old married man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has two dependent children who are currently in school. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business; growing rice and sells the crop to the local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this career for around twenty years. The average income that he is able to make is USD 2.00 per day. 

Because the earning that he can generate from farming is very little, he has now come up with a business idea. He wants to open a grocery store to serve people in his community. Therefore, Douen would like to apply for a KIVA loan and he will use this loan as a capital investment to open a grocery store. With the support from this loan, he hopes that he can get more income and improve his standard of living. He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 61 years old and married with seven children. Two of her children are in school.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Leonila aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old, married and has four children.  

Grace is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Grace has been raising livestock for twenty years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable-vending business.

Guillerma has been in this business for 10 years. Guillerma earns additional income from a general store.

Guillerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hedeliza

texts.en:
Hedeliza is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Hedeliza is 37 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Hedeliza has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Hedeliza requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Hedeliza has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Hedeliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Janeth works very hard to provide for them.

Janeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Janeth has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a food cafe. She’s had it for more than four years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that she has a good clientele.

She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Her main challenges are seasonality and high transportation costs.

Jennifer is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil and other products.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Eunice operates a vegetable-selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

 With the loan, she want to purchase sacks of kale, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access the funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of kale, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 35 years old, and a father of one child. He is a hard working man and a cattle trader; he buys cattle and fattens it to mature early. He also sells dairy products for additional income. A major challenge for him is the changing price of meat. 

Steven started this business because there was demand for cattle in the towns of Kyenjojo and beyond. He has dreams of educating his children and turning his trading into a large cattle business to supply all butcheries in surrounding towns. Steven has asked for a loan to buy more cows for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Doña Alicia, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 6 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Yoro junto a su esposo y tres de sus hijos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y frijoles. La producción es vendida en la misma zona de donde obtiene sus ingresos para la familia. Actualmente esta solicitando el segundo préstamo en la institución para asistir el cultivo el cual es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra  para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de frijol y obtener mejor producción. Su meta es construir un apartamento y remodelar su casa para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 54, is married, has 6 children and lives in a village of the town Yoro along with her husband and three of her children. She has always worked in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans. The production is sold in the same area where she gets the incomes for her family. 

She is currently asking for her second loan with the institution in order to maintain her crops. The loan is for 10,000 lempiras and will be used to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to give maintenance to her bean crops, thus improving her production. 

Her goal is to build and apartment and to remodel her house in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to give maintenance to her bean crops.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons, her husband is the guardian of her family and responsible to manage the household.

Sadia has also been running a primary school to provide quality education to the poor children and earn income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. Sadia needs to buy different kinds of toys for play group children who are learning in her school, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to buy the toys for her school. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will purchase toys to fulfill the needs of her education business.

For this financial support, Sadia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy toys for play group children in her school.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is 50; she is mother to five children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. For the past many days his rickshaw hs not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Hameeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Hameeda is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair costs of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Hilda Amalia

texts.es: Hilda de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, trabaja de elaborar piñatas para fiestas de cumpleaños su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza ha logrado cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito que le permita comprar más materiales como: papeles de todo tipo de colores, pegamento, alambre, papel de diario entre otras cosas que le sirven para la elaboración ya que ha tenido buenos resultados con las ventas y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias y podrá seguirle dando a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 41-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in a house of their own. She works making piñatas for birthday parties. Her business is located at her own place of residence, and with her sales she has managed to pay for the household expenses. 

She is requesting once again a loan that will allow her to buy more materials, like: papers in all types and colors, glue, wire, newspaper, among other items that she needs for her production. 

She has had good sales results, and with the help of this loan she will improve her earnings and will be able to keep providing her kids with all that they need without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy papers in all types and colors, glue, wire, newspaper, among other items.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 23 years old. She is single. Aziza is a very hardworking woman. She has learned how to sew national women's dresses from her mother. She very much likes sewing dresses. Aziza now is a sewer. She has been busy with sewing national women's dresses for more than 2 years. 

She sews a variety of dresses and also follows the new fashions. She has regular customers, thanks to her good service. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy coal and wood for the winter season. She lives with her parents in the North part of Tajikistan in the countryside where there is a deficiency of electricity. 

She awaits your support and needs your help.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for the winter season.

loans.name: Chelsie

texts.en:
A merchant from Leyte, Philippines, Chelsie has earned an income through her sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She is married and has one child. For more than six years now, this business has provided Chelsie with the income that she needs.

Chelsie would like to take a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, noodles, bread, biscuits, soap and toiletries. This loan will enable Chelsie to augment her inventories thus attracting more buyers and customers. 

In the future, Chelsie wants to expand her store so that it generates more business. She also wants to save money for her child's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, noodles, bread, biscuits, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anita is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Anita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Analie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like lumber, nails, paints, etc for her furniture-making business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like lumber, nails, paints.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Gina has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestocks.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, aged 22, lives in Kapsowar, which is a small agricultural center in Rift valley Kenya. He is a husband and a father of one adorable boy. 

Evans started a mixed farm in 2011 and continues to farm for a living. His primary income sources are eggs, poultry and crops. Evans enjoys poultry farming and dairy farming above all other activities. The main challenges he faces with this type of farming are disease outbreaks and expensive dairy feed.

Evans is asking for a loan to buy a quality breed of sheep. To him, raising sheep is an enjoyable and lucrative farming experience. He understands the challenges that come with sheep farming and the market uncertainties. This knowledge has influenced his strategic plans to incorporate a few measures beforehand. Sheep farming is very profitable and Evans will benefit from sheep wool which fetches high prices in the local and international markets. 

He plans to use the income from this investment to repay the loan and to pay for his child's education. When he was asked how the loan would benefit his family, he said, “I will be able to educate my child and also feed my family.”

loans.use: To buy sheeps to raise

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Arlene has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, rice, noodles, shampoo, shampoo, candies, etc. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rao Abdul Sattar

texts.en:
Rao Abdul lives in Karachi. He is 44, married and a father of 4. He is a hardworking and skilled person. He is the sole person earning in the family. 

He started with an auto repair shop 15 years ago, added spare parts sales to his business and grew his business likewise. Now that his business has grown he still wants his business to become self sustainable. 

He wants to boost his business therefore has requested for a loan. He will buy additional spare parts for his shop so his business can grow and will increase his living standards with the profits.

loans.use: To purchase auto spare parts for his auto repair and spare parts shop.

loans.name: Abert

texts.en:
Abert is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda and a father of 5 children. He deals in cattle trade. He buys cattle and fattens so it is mature faster for the cattle market. He earns extra income from dairy products he sells like ghee and milk however he is faced with lack of capital to improve on pasture for his animals. 

Abert wants a loan to buy more cattle to fatten and sell in preparation for Christmas when he expects high sales.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married mother of five children, all of whom are in school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor running water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Juliet dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

Juliet decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she plans to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Sakda

texts.en: Sakda is 22 years old, a homemaker with a two-year-old child living in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Her husband is 25 and has been a a construction worker since 2008, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband always goes to work far from home, so she decided to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work. This loan will help her husband reduce his traveling expenses. For more future plans in her family, she wants to have a business selling vegetables and fish at the market, have a new house and help her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.en:
Valijon is hardworking and smart man. He is the careful father of four boys, who are all still school-aged. His wife is a housewife, so he is the only breadwinner in his family. 

Valijon has teaching qualifications, and he has worked for more than 14 years at a secondary school in Tajik-Turkey. He has had a great experience as a teacher, and he is one of the best teachers at the school. 

His son also studies at the school, and Valijon has to pay for his education. Valijon is asking for a loan of 1,500 US dollars to pay for the tuition of his son, shown in this photo. He awaits your mercy

loans.use: To pay for education for his son

loans.name: Nhar

texts.en:
Nhar is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two dependent children who are currently in school. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business; growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for around ten years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day on average.  

Because the earning that she can generate from farming is every little, she has now come up with a business idea. She wants to open a grocery store to serve people in her community. Therefore, Nhar would like to apply for KIVA loan and she will use this loan as capital investment to open a grocery store. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her standard of living. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina works hard to support her family. Maria Gina has a business buying and selling clothing in the Philippines.

Maria Gina requested a 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory of clothing to sell, like long sleeved tops, shoes, blouses, etc. 

Maria Gina has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, Maria Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothing to sell, like long sleeved tops, shoes, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 25-year-old single man living in Chebiemit, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, he owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off of, just under half an acre, and has always struggled to support his family. His primary source of income has been crops and some small personal business he engages in to supplement his meager income. 

Leonard passionately loves sheep farming, but one challenge he has been facing is a lack of funds to buy a sheep. He is kindly seeking a loan to buy a superior breed of sheep. From the loan, he will get sheep wool, which fetches high prices in both the local and international market. He will also get sheep meat that he will sell to his neighbors and to the local market. 

Feeding the sheep will never be a challenge for Leonard because he has planted forage on his farm and will be supplementing this by cutting plants at the river bank for fodder. This will assure him of increased wool production.

This loan is going to impact the life of Leonard positively. Leonard is already thinking ahead, and with the loan, he plans to increase his wool production and sell to the international market. Other than wool from the sheep, he will benefit from the manure, which will improve his farm fertility and result in high productivity. All that Leonard waits for is for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a superior breed of sheep

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is 31 years old and married with three children.

Cecille works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Cecille has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cecille aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Flory

texts.en:
Flory is 30 years old and married with five children; three of her children are in school. Flory works very hard to provide for them.

Flory runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like cooking oil, groceries, etc.

Flory has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as salt, biscuits, onions, garlic, etc.

In the future, Flory would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like cooking oil, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en: Vutha is 37 years old, and a married woman with five children living in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She makes baskets for sale and she has been in this work since 1999. Three of her children are students and one is a garment-factory worker. Her husband is 37 years old, and a farmer. Together, they can earn approximately $10 a day. Now Vutha would like to request a loan to buy more farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her husband earn more income for the family. In the future, she is going to build fences around her house and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear wholesale

loans.name: Azizakhon

texts.en:
Azizakhon was born in 1974. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman. Azizakhon is also is a businesswoman. Azizakhon has been busy with buying and selling dried fruits more than 20 years. She buys fruits, processes fruits, dries fruits and sells in a local market. Azizakhon manages the business alone. She also sells dried fruits in markets in other regions of Tajikistan. 

Azizakhon now needs to your financial support because she is going to buy coal and wood for keeping warm in her house in the winter season. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for keeping warm in her house in the winter season

loans.name: Egleceria

texts.en: Egleceria is managing her rice farm, she earns a meager income from it that primarily supports their family. She is a very industrious and persevering mother when it comes to the benefit of her family, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. Egleceria is very thankful when all her financing needs were supported by PMPC, of which she became a member in 2010. Recently, she benefitted from another loan to buy farm inputs and pay for labor costs in land preparation on her rice farm. Someday, she deeply wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor costs in land preparation on her rice farm.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy is a single woman who lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has a meat stall located in their marketplace. She has been in business for 13 years. This is business really helps a lot to sustain the needs of her family.  Because she wants to purchase two pigs for her business to increase her inventory, is asking for a loan through PMPC in the amount of PHP 14,900.00. She dreams to have another place where she can sell to generate more income to give to her family.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs for the business to sustain the demands of the customers.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance in her own school's stationary shop.

loans.name: Muhammad Shafiq

texts.en:
Muhammad, 36, laid the foundation of his scrap work business nine years ago with a small investment and has managed to improve his business and earn a good living. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife and looks after the house. All his children go to school. 

He recently got an offer for old drum which he wants to buy, refurbish and sell at a profit. He has therefore requested a loan to help him arrange for the financing through BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. He is hopeful for a better future and wants to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase an old drum, refurbish the drum and sell it.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. Anita has been in this business for four years now. 

Anita requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Wilmor

texts.en: Wilmor joined PMPC for his needed capital. He knew this would be his chance to finance his business. He applied for a loan for the next cropping season. The loan is the amount to pay for seedlings and compost to sustain his farming business.  Wilmor perseveres and always believes in order to reach his goals to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
This is Anafe. She previously received a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and pay for the maintenance of her family's tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Anafe would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anafe wants for her business to become more established. She desires a prosperous life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her family's tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 44 years old, and married with seven children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nila has a food selling business in the Philippines. She has asked for a 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nila has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married and has operated a food-vending business in the Philippines for six years now. She works hard to support her family.

Emilia has requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle, 47 years old, is a married mother of five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

The operator of a general store in the Philippines for 10 years, Anabelle is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as oil, eggs, charcoal, soy sauce, sugar, shampoo, etc. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like oil, eggs, charcoal, soysauce, sugar, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is a 36-year-old man who is married with three school-going children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, and has a cocoa garden, a retail shop and a motorcycle that is used to transport people. 

He is very hardworking, and he used the old loan to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to expand his business, though he is limited by capital. He wants the loan to buy general merchandise like cooking oil, rice and macarons to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, like cooking oil, rice and macarons to sell.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charina is 27 years old, and one child is currently in school.

Charina has a buying and selling of dry goods business in the Philippines. Charina requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods, like umbrellas, t-shirts, slippers, sandals, etc., to sell.

Charina has been in this business for seven years. Charina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods, like umbrellas, t-shirts, slippers, sandals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a very hardworking person who has always worked to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a food cafe; she’s had it for three years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood, and she now has a good clientele. She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. 

Rachael is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, onions, rice, chicken, cooking oil and other products to stock her cafe and have good products to offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, rice, chicken and cooking oil

loans.name: José Manuel Orlando

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad,  vive con sus 3 hijos de edades entre 6 y 14 años, 2 le ayudan a trabajar en la milpa ya que el otro esta pequeño, actualmente no estudian porque les queda demasiado y su compañera de vida que se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José es un hombre muy responsable y dedicado totalmente a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años, trabajando al lado de su padre que fue quien le enseño a cultivar la tierra, aparte de cultivar la tierra, José sabe trabajar de electricista y eso le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos para darle una buena alimentación a su familia. 

José nos expresa que ha cultivado 7 medios de frijol cerca de su casa y necesita comprar algunos insumos para el mantenimiento del cultivo, ya que está siendo atacado por algunas plagas y enfermedades, además quiere echarle un poco de abono para que pueda mejorar su producción. Por eso solicita el crédito, para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas y abono para su cultivo de frijol.

José en un futuro quiere construir una casa nueva para que sus hijos tengan un lugar más sano donde divertirse y sus futuras generaciones tengan mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
40 year old José lives with his 3 children who are aged between 6 and 14. 2 of them help him to work in the corn fields and the other is too small. They are currently not in school. His partner works as a domestic employee.
José is a very responsible person and totally dedicated to his family. He has been working in agriculture since he was 10 years old, working alongside his father who taught him how to cultivate the earth. Apart from this, José knows how to work as an electrician and this helps him to improve his income so that he can feed his family well. 
José tells us that he has planted 7 types of bean close to his house and needs to buy some supplies to look after the crops as they are being attacked by some pests and diseases. He also wants to add some fertilizer to improve production. For these reasons, he is requesting a loan to buy pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizer for his bean crops.
In the future, José wants to build a new house so that his children have a healthier place where they can enjoy themselves and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, herbicides and fertilizer for his bean crops.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta lives in Viqueque. She is married and she has six children. She is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes, and she is also selling kitchen tools. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more clothes such as women's shirts, men's shirts, skirts and other clothes to sell, as well as kitchen tools. 

Julieta has been involved in business activities since 2009. She started with her own working capital of $1,500. She is earning a good income from selling her clothes and kitchen tools because many people like to buy them, so she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy women's shirts, men's shirts, skirts and other clothes to sell, as well as kitchen tools.

loans.name: Essi Dorothée

texts.fr: Dorothée est âgée de 34 ans et est née à kpalimé de nationalité togolaise. Dorothée est divorcée et n’a pas d’enfants à charge. Dorothée est  coiffeuse et habite le quartier Adidogomé. Elle a commencé son activité depuis 2008 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé 2 fois par semaine. Pour renforcer son activité, elle demande un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des mèches et tissages. Dorothée a un niveau secondaire et vit dans une maison en location ou le bâtiment est couvert de tôle avec de l’électricité a l’interne et des latrines traditionnelles.
texts.en: Dorothée is 34 years old, of Togolese nationality and was born in Kpalimé. She is divorced and has no children in her care. She is a hairdresser and lives in the Adidogomé district. She began her business in 2008 and gets her supplies twice a week at Lomé's Grand Market. She is requesting a loan to boost her business and this will allow her to buy hair extensions and hair weaves. Dorothée has a secondary level of education and lives in a rented house with a sheet metal roof, electricity inside and traditional latrines.

loans.use: to buy two dozen hair extensions and two dozen hair weaves.

loans.name: Bark Wenaam Group

texts.fr: Bark wenaam est un groupe de 4 femmes battantes qui travaille très bien avec ACFIME. Ganama est mariée, mère de 5 enfants, alphabétisée et coiffeuse de profession. En plus de faire la coiffure, elle vend des draps de lit et des produits de beauté( mèches, pommade d'entretien de peau et de des cheveux). Ce prêt permettra à Ganama d’acheter plus de produits de beauté pour attirer plus la clientèle. Aussi, pour les remboursements, il n’y aura aucun problème puisque le groupe de Ganama respecte toujours les échéances. Le bénéfice servira à prendre soins de sa famille et de renforcer son salon de coiffure.
texts.en: Bark Wenaam is a group of four fighting women who work well together with ACFIME. Ganama is married, mother to five children, literate and a hairdresser by profession. As well as practising hairdressing she sells bed sheets and beauty products (hair extensions, skin creams and hair lotions). This loan will enable Ganama to buy more beauty products so she can attract more customers. As far as the loan repayments are concerned there will be no problem as Ganama's group always respects it repayment schedule. The profits Ganama makes will be used to take care of her family and boost her hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and other materials for her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Monynet

texts.en: Monynet is a 22-year-old married garment factory worker with a small child living in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. Having been a worker since 2012, she can earn approximately $5 a day. Her husband is 25, he collects taxes from sellers at a market during the day and he also works as a security guard at night earning $7 a day. Now Monynet would like to request a loan to buy lumber, bricks and cement to build a kitchen and a bathroom with a toilet. This loan will provide her with better living conditions. In the future, she is going to fatten animals at home, renovate her house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy lumber, bricks and cement to build a kitchen and a bathroom with a toilet.

loans.name: Madinakhon

texts.en:
Madinakhon, who was born in 1992, is a married mother of one child. She lives with her husband, child and mother-in-law in the country. 

A very hardworking woman, for more than three years Madinakhon has been buying dried fruits, mainly kuraga, in bulk, reselling them in a local market. She uses her profits to provide her family with all necessary things. Madinakhon’s husband helps her in managing the business. 

Madinakhon is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy coal and wood for the winter season. Her child is little and she must keep her house warm to keep him healthy. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for the winter season

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is 57 years old and lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta, Philippines. She is married with children. Lucita has sells dried fish and longanisa. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase five kilos of dried fish & 100 packs of longaniza (processed meat) to generate income for the family. Lucita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to have a stall for her business.

loans.use: to purchase five kilos of dried fish & 100 packs of longaniza (processed meat).

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 36 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is married and has operated a chain saw machine for almost five years. She requested a loan to buy another chainsaw to rent. She offers timber-cutting services, especially to those who are into construction. Arlene has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Arlene hopes to buy an additional unit for the expansion of her business into nearby places.

loans.use: to buy another chainsaw to sustain the demands of the customers.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 61 años de edad, casado, sin hijos, y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Él es emprendedor, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ distante a 60 kilómetros de la ciudad, caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, de clima fuertemente frío donde los rayos solares golpean la superficie terrestre con mucha fuerza.
Francisco es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro/gris, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza con su esposa que se encarga de la agricultura, ambos viven en una casa de adobe con los servicios de luz y agua de pozo, juntos realizan la producción artesanal de queso y derivados lácteos. En el lugar se respira tranquilidad. El olor a queso invade cada esquina de su casa.  El proceso que sigue es el siguiente; comienza certificando la leche para conocer el rendimiento que tendrá, Luego de certificar la leche, se comienza con el proceso de transformación con la cocción a una temperatura de 70 grados centígrados, durante 30 minutos aproximadamente. Después se deja enfriar y se le añade el cuajo y la sal. “Una vez está el punto de temperatura, se extrae del suero y se pasa a un tiempo de escurrido, para que seque completamente”, me explica, luego de la cuajada viene el moldeado. Allí, el queso toma forma para luego definirse la cantidad que saldrá a la venta, ya sea de 150, 300, 500 gramos o de 1 kilo. “Luego seguimos con la refrigeración. Para ello, debe estar bajo una temperatura de entre 1 y 4 grados centígrados”, explica.
Este es la primera secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 25 años de experiencia en el rubro. Su negocio necesita la obtención constante de leche y necesita realizar la compra de ganado lechero.
Es por esos motivos que Francisco solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y mejorar su producción de queso artesanal para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 61 year old man who is married and has no children. He works making artisanal cheese. 
He is enterprising, steady, responsible, and hardworking. He works in the community of Batallas, 60km from the city, which is close to the sacred lake Titicaca and which has a very cold climate but where the suns rays strike the earth with great force. 
Francisco has a dark complexion, is of medium hight, and has black and gray hair. His mother tongue is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for work. He lives his life with his wife who is a farmer. They live together in an adobe house that has electricity and water. Together, they make artisanal cheese and dairy products. Their place is tranquil. The scent of cheese is in every corner of their house. The process he follows is: he begins by testing the cheese so that he knows how it will perform. After testing the milk, he begins the transformation by cooking it at a temperature of 70 degrees for about 30 minutes. Then, he leaves it to cool and adds rennet and salt. "Once it's at the right temperature, the whey is removed and it is drained for a time until it is completely dry", he explains. Later, the curd is put into molds. Here the cheese takes form and later he decides in what quantity to sell it, either in 150g, 300g, 500g, or 1kg. "Later, we refrigerate it. For this, it must be at a temperature between 1 and 4 degrees centigrade", he explains. 
This is his first loan from the institution and he has 25 years of experience in this trade. His business needs a constant supply of milk and he needs to buy cows milk.
For this reason, Francisco is requesting a loan to buy cows milk and improve his production of artisanal cheese to improve his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy cow milk and improve his production of artisanal cheese for his family's wellbeing.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy is 24 years old, she is single and lives with her parents and three siblings in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her parents are both farmers, they are also engaged in different farming activities to sustain their family. They mastered doing these types of activities when they got married, supported their needs and their education until Mary Joy graduated. She became a teacher and joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on May 2014. As an eldest daughter, she has a strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family. Mary Joy requested a loan to pay for her sister's college school fees, she wants to support her siblings and help them to finish their studies until they get their own jobs as well. Someday, with the help and support of her siblings, she hopes to build their parents a decent house and fulfill their needs for their sacrifices and the hardships given to them.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's college school fees.

loans.name: Katheryn

texts.en:
Katheryn is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Katheryn is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Katheryn has a buying and selling of delicacies business in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional delicacies to sell.

Katheryn has been in this business for one year. In the future, Katheryn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy additional delicacies to sell

loans.name: Yostas

texts.en:
Yostas is a 59 year-old married man with six children. He owns cattle in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started his cattle business with capital saved from his primary activity of farming. He buys and sells cattle in different markets in Kyenjojo. He experiences business challenges due to competition for customers for cattle. 

Yostas has a vision to grow his business. He has asked for a loan to buy cattle for selling ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cattle for selling ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 33 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, cereals, seasonings, sanitary pads, noodles, bread, etc. to sell.

Belinda has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Belinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, cereals, seasonings, sanitary pads, noodles, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
Felna is 36 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, Felna works very hard to provide for them.

Felna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like noodles, juice, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, toothpaste, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Felna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like noodles, juice, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Asibi

texts.fr: Asibi est âgée de 42 ans et est née à Lomé de nationalité togolaise.Elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Asibi est revendeuse de mais, charbon, harico et des tubercules d'igname et habite le quartier Adidogomé. Asibi a commencé son activité depuis 1993 et s’approvisionne a notsè. Elle a un niveau moyen en éducation et vit dans une maison en location couvert de tuile avec de l’électricité avec latrines moderne. Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 180 tubercules d'igname et avec ce revenu, Asibi pourra subvenir aux dépenses de ses enfants.
texts.en: Asibi is 42 years old, of Togolese nationality and born in Lomé. She is single and mother to two children. Asibi sells corn, charcoal, beans and yam tubers, and lives in the Adidogomé district. She began her business in 1993 and gets her supplies in Notsé. She has an average level of education and lives in a rented house with a tiled roof, electricity and modern bathroom. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 180 yam tubers, and with the income she gets she will be able to provide for her children's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 18à yam tubers.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben, age 32, is an old client from the Ishaka branch of the institution. He is a married man with one child, who has not yet started school. His major source of income since 2006 is boda boda (motorcycle) riding in Ishaka town. This is because it's profitable. His clients are all categories of people. He is a very hardworking man and has seen his business grow steadily since 2006 to date. His major challenge is poor roads, but he has learnt to manage it.

Lauben also started farming to be able to have a steady source of income to care for his family. He has a banana plantation to supplement his income. He is an honest and hardworking man, which has helped him strive in his business. 

Lauben has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings only to buy another motorcycle for his business. Pictured is Lauben and wife.

loans.use: To buy a boda boda (motorcycle) for his transport business

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman, who has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, Mapenzi has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables, such as wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as the major challenges in her business. 

Mapenzi is requesting a 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Lluvia De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LLUVIA DE ORO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, compra de vehículos, venta de regalos, venta de repuestos de automóviles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janneth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de su madre, a quien apoyaba en su negocio, con el pasar del tiempo y con un capital ahorrado decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles) que adquirirá de las carpinterías mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y vive con sus padres que son personas adultas mayores.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el compañerismo que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group Lluvia de Oro (Golden Rain) will begin it's first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, part of Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Jenneth is the President. The businesses that the members run are varied, and include: selling cosmetics, selling vegetables, buying vehicles, selling gifts, selling automobile parts.
The loan that they are requesting will be used to benefit the micro-entrepreneurs of which Janneth is one. She says that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer and she joined on the invite of a staff member of the institution who visited her in her home. Currently, she has a business selling furniture. She tells us that she learned this business from her mother, who she supported in her business. Over time, and with some savings, she decided to start an independent business. 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her capital and to buy furniture which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later sell in the markets in the city of El Alto. This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family economically as she is single and lives with her parents who are seniors. 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the companionship that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en: Sothea is 21 years old, a university student and also a bus-ticket seller living in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Having been in this business since 2013, she can earn approximately $5 a day. Due to a lack of finances, Sothea would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she wants to work for any company and have her own proper house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en: Bunna is a 26-year-old student in the city and he is also a monk from the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. His major at university is Management. Due to a shortage of financial support, he would like to request a loan to pay for his university fees. This loan will help him graduate. After graduation, he is going to find a good job.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus has always had enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns an income that primarily supports her family. At the age of 26 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently to provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital that is supporting her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for compost and labor costs in land preparation on her rice farm. In the future, Venus wishes to see her family in good living conditions and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to pay for compost and labor costs in land preparation on her rice farm.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is earning a living doing farming activities. At the age of 50 and married, she has never stopped pursuing her goals for the sake of the family. Divina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. From her desire to earn extra income, she decided to engage in pig raising business, PMPC stood by her to start her chosen business. Now, she has applied for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy bags of feed for her growing pigs and purchase bags of farm fertilizer for a productive harvest. Divina continues to seek business ideas, proof that she has the determination to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed for her growing pigs and purchase bags of farm fertilizer for a productive harvest.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Kokoè est âgée de 41 ans et est née à Lomé. Kokoè est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est tresseuse et habite à Adidogomé quartier situé au nord ouest de Lomé. Kokoè à commencé son activité en 1996 et s’approvisionne 3 fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. kokoè sollicite ce crédit pour l'achat de mèches et accessoires pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Kokoè is 41 years old and she was born in Lomé. She is married and mother to four children. She is a hair braider and lives in the Adidogomé district in the north west of Lomé. Kokoè began her business in 1996 and gets her supplies three times a month at Lomé's Grand Market. She is requesting this loan to buy hair extensions and accessories to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy two dozen hair extensions and four sets of hair weaves.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Dovi est âgée de 33 ans et est née à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagne et habite le quartier Adidogomé. Dovi a commencé son activité depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au grand marché de lomé. Dovi sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité. 
Dovi vit en location dont le toit est couvert de tôle avec de l’électricité avec une latrine moderne. Avec les revenus issus de cette activité, Dovi pourra établir les pièces d’identité de ses enfants et assurer leur éducation.
texts.en:
Dovi is 33 years old and was born in Lomé. She is married and mother to two children. She sells "pagnes" (brightly colored pieces of African fabric) and lives in the Adidogomé district. Dovi began her business in 2003 and gets her supplies twice a month at Lomé's Grand Market. She is requesting this loan to boost her business. 

Dovi lives in rented accommodation where the roof is covered with sheet metal; there is electricity and a modern bathroom. With the income she gets from this business Dovi can get identity cards for her children and provide for their education.

loans.use: to buy 12 pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Leonarda works hard to provide for her family.

She has a rug-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Leonarda is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more materials for her rug-making business. She has been sustaining her business activities thanks to 5 previous loans from NWTF. 

Leonarda hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Jobert

texts.en: Jobert is a strong-willed man who pushes his ability when it comes to his farming activities. He is a hands-on business-farmer and father who never gets tired of providing support for his family. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase bags of farm fertilizer and compost to increase crop yield and pay for labor costs in land and seedbed preparation. Someday he hopes to own a truck to be used in delivering his agricultural products in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of farm fertilizer and compost to increase crop yield and pay for labor costs in land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy was fortunate to get needed capital when he joined PMPC in 2013. He has two infant-aged children. He knew this would be his opportunity to start his business. PMPC came to Roy as a rescuer for lending him money when he needed it badly. Now, he has applied for another loan for this quarter's cropping. He loaned an amount to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides to maximize his farm production and able to generate more income. Roy perseveres and always believes to reach his goal of abundantly providing for his family.

loans.use: to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Victoria has a music bar business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional music equipment for her business. She has been in this business for one year. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional music equipment for her  business.

loans.name: Evelyntina

texts.en:
Evelyntina is 71 years old and widowed with five children.

Evelyntina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyntina has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from rice-retailing and pig-fattening.

Evelyntina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nyankwanzi Tweimukye Klezia Group

texts.en:
Moses is a 35-year-old married man with two children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He obtains his income from brewing waragi and derives additional income from growing and selling beans, maize and soya beans. He started the business in order to improve his family's income and welfare. 

Moses is hardworking and hopes to build a permanent home. He currently faces a challenge of unfavourable weather that affects sugarcane: the raw material from which waragi is brewed. Moses needs the loan to purchase waragi to sell.

loans.use: to purchase waragi to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old. She is married with 7 children, 4 of whom are still in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Vilma has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsa de 27 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y luchadora de sus sueños, actualmente es empleada en el ministerio de salud y vive con su compañero de vida quien trabaja como ordenanza y su hijo de un año y 7 mes de edad.
Elsa después de haber culminado sus estudios en la rama de la medicina, trabajo un año como instructora, luego trabajo 1 año en un asilo para ancianos y por ultimo está trabajando como promotora de salud.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para cancelar una deuda, ya que tiene muchas obligaciones con su hijo y necesita tener más ingresos para comprar sus alimentos y vitaminas que demanda el crecimiento de su hijo.

Su sueño es tener un mejor empleo para que sus condiciones de vida mejoren y así poder darle lo mejor a su hijo para que tenga un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27 years old and is a responsible woman who works towards her dreams. She is currently employed in the Ministry of Health and lives with her partner (who works as a messenger) and her 7 year old son.
After finishing her studies in the medical field, Elsa worked for a year as an instructor. Later, she worked for a year in a home for seniors, and is now working as a health promotor. 
She is requesting a loan to pay-off a debt as she has many obligations regarding her son and needs more income to buy food and vitamins that he needs in order to grow. 
Her dream is to have a better job so that she can improve her living conditions and give her son the best so that he has a good future.

loans.use: to pay-off a debt, as she has many obligations regarding her son and needs to have more income to buy food.

loans.name: Jawa Group

texts.en:
Nisrine, Ali and Marcel are three young Syrian refugees who are respectively 28, 26 and 30 years old. They have been living in Lebanon since the beginning of the crisis in Syria in 2011 and are working as entertainers, performing plays and shows about their experience as Syrian refugees in Lebanon. 
Nisrine and Ali who both completed their studies in Arts, have been married for four years and traveled together to Lebanon to escape the violence in Syria. Marcel is also married to a Syrian refugee who participates himself in the shows as a dancer. 
After the success of their first play dedicated to traumatized Syrian kids back in July 2014, Nisrine, Ali and Marcel are asking for a 1,500,000 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa to buy accessories they still need and print promotional brochures for their upcoming play that will be targeting adults this time. In the play, the artists are planning to share their experience with the Lebanese public through dance performances and poetry.

loans.use: to buy accessories and print brochures for their upcoming play

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is 26 and she is a mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works to sell dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffaloes and cows. Daily, he sells milk to different tea stalls. He is an honest man and he manages his household necessities with his earnings from milk sales. He speaks in a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through milk sales, so Sajida asked for loan. In this way she can support to her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's milk business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 33 years old and married. She lives with two children and her husband in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. 

Srey is a farmer and also sells body lotion and face powder. Both of her children attend school. Her husband is a 39-year-old taxi driver, and together they can earn approximately $25 a day. 

Now Srey would like to request a loan to buy an ox for rice farming. This loan will help her improve her family’s finances. 

For her future plans, she is going to buy more farmland for rice farming. She also wants to build fences around her house, and to help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy an ox for rice farming

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
Raafat is a 43 year old taxi driver who lives with his wife and their six children in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. While four of the children are still in school, two of them have already started working to support their parents in covering the family's expenses. One of his sons is also a taxi driver and the other one works as a construction worker inside the camp. 
His wife being unemployed, Raafat got his own car to work as a taxi driver after 20 years of experience in the business. He is known in the camp for his long experience and his loyal clients. 
Raafat is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to cover the maintenance costs for his car. Keeping his car in good condition will allow him to continue providing his clients with a good service and boost his monthly income. Such an increase in the family's revenues will improve Raafat, his wife and his children's living conditions and boost their motivation to work for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his car

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her business. She has been in this business for 28 years and also earns more income from food vending and a general store.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 34 year old DJ, event organizer, and event planner. He is currently residing in a Palestinian refugee camp located in northern Lebanon with his wife and two children, a boy and a girl, both of whom go to school. His wife being unemployed, hosting parties is the family's main source of income which pushed Rami to also paint houses and decorate them for extra revenue. 
Rami is asking for a 2,057,996 Lebanese Pound loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He applied for this loan in order to purchase new sound equipment and modernize and update some of his old soundboards. He believes that with the help of this loan, he can manage to increase his monthly income by at least 30%.  He hosts around 3, 4 parties or events monthly.

loans.use: purchase new sound equipment and modernize some of his old soundboards

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 49 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. She has been married to her husband for more than twenty five years and together they have seven children. They have four daughters and three sons. Two of her daughters are married, one is planning to get married soon and the youngest is still in school. Her three sons also still go to school. 
Amira's business has been the only source of income for the family for a long time since her husband is suffering from health problems and cannot work actively. She has more than twenty years experience in selling used clothes and furniture and the demand for her merchandise is high especially from people with low income.
