Amira is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She plans on using the loan to buy furniture and increase her sales which will allow her to support her household's expenses and provide her husband and children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her stocks in clothes

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
This is Eleonor, 42, a resident of Coron, Palawan in the Philippines. She is married to Alexander, a fisherman and also a carpenter. Together they have children, and Eleonor and her husband manage their household by operating their businesses. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Eleonor operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes a profit by buying her supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece. Eleonor's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in daily sales.

Eleonor is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Eleonor hopes to maintain her business' increasing profit. This way, she will be able to provide her children with a good education. 

Eleonor meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed to stock her variety store.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years, and also earns more income from farming rice.

Celestina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 14 years now.

Marcela has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, cereals, salt, sugar, biscuits, etc. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Lorna has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Hillary does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but he is an accomplished farmer from the Kericho area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. He is a family man, and he has two lovely children, whom he really loves and cherishes.

Hillary and his wife work as a team, supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past five years. Hillary often says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of the liking that he has for farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows “Kamwana,” which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. From his dairy cow, he is able to get between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day, and this helps him support his family.

Hillary also practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; and therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Hillary is very visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Hillary believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his children a solid education background. This loan will be Hillary’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is fifty-two years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Rosalinda and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Now she is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. With your help, Rosalinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family..

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Dina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell medicine business in the Philippines, and Dina also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  

Dina has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional medicine to sell from her buy-and-sell medicine business.

Dina has been sustaining her business activities with help from 10 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Doña Marina tiene 57 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee desde hace 10 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Doña Marina está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Doña Marina is 57 years old and lives at home with her husband.  She has had a store located in her place of residence for 10 years.  She has many costumers due to the product variety and the friendliness that she has when selling. 

Doña Marina is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, pastries, etc; and, therefore, be able to have better income for a better quality of life together with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and married with four children; two of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lourdes has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lourdes has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lourdes is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marylee

texts.en:
Marylee is 38 years old and married with one child currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Marylee runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, sugar, milk, juice, etc. 

Marylee requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Marylee would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De San Martin Group

texts.es: Dúo las Victorias de San Martin La señora Victoria se dedica a la venta de calzado en diferentes estilos, tallas, colores, para damas, caballeros y niños en piel y cuerina. con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y sus tres hijos quienes la ayudan a atender los locales le da muchas gracias a Dios por la bendición de su negocio.  Su sueño cada amanecer es seguir creciendo y obtener otros locales y dejarles una buena herencia para sus hijos a través de un negocio.  Las ventas están muy bien y ya necesita surtir de zapatos en general la venta porque las fiestas navideñas se aproximan.  Hay varios pedidos de calzados pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por ese motivo necesita nuevamente otro préstamo y comprar lo que le falta de zapato para no quedarles mal a sus clientes y aprovechar las fechas de venta y obtener buenas ganancias.  Su compañera es la señora María Faustina de 43 años de edad.
texts.en:
Dúo las Victorias de San Martin.  La señora Victoria sells footwear of different styles, sizes, and colors in leather and leatherette for men, women, and children.  With the unconditional support of her husband and her three children who help her to attend to the stores, she gives many thanks to God for blessing her business.  

Her dream each morning is to continue growing and obtaining more stores and to leave a good legacy for her children through a business.  The sales are very good, and she already needs to restock shoes in general because the holidays are approaching.  

There are several orders for shoes but the money that she has is not enough.  For this reason, she needs a new loan to buy the shoes she is lacking so that her costumers have shoes that fit well; to take advantage of sale dates; and to obtain good profits.  

Her partner is la señora María Faustina who is 43 years old.

loans.use: To buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Estela works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Estela is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the store for 20 years. She also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid off 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a businessman involved in coffee trading. He is married with 6 children, ages 17, 15, 13, 11, 9 and 7 years.  He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 (Three million shillings only) to buy coffee for trade. 

He also does agriculture specializing in coffee farming where he earns additional income to supplement his monthly income. He is a hardworking man who works 7 hours a day and 6 days a week. 

He started his business in the year 1999 in a rural setting, and has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work. The business is carried from Nyakabingo, Kakanju. 

His customers are factories and coffee traders in western Uganda, and their continued support and his tireless efforts have helped his business to grow. He started this very business to be able to have a source of income to care for his family's needs.  

Wilson's major challenges in the business are limited capital and competition from other coffee traders, but he is ready to grow through his hard work. He hopes that the prices may stabilize well in the future and that he can grow his business.

loans.use: To buy coffee for trade.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 31, is married with three children and two of her children are in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Maricel has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Maricel has taken out a 10000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Maricel is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sophang

texts.en:
Sophang is a 21-year-old student and also a receptionist at a hotel in Siem Reap province of Cambodia. His major is Management. He has been in the job since 2013, earning $5 daily. 

Because he is short of financial support, he would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees for four years. This loan will help him graduate. For his future dreams, he wants to be a general manager in any private company and to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for four years.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
This is Anthony, 32, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Belen and he is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Anthony maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning and works until late in the evening. There are times when he drives until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit.

His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 800 in his transportation business every day. Aside from his transportation service, he collects and sells scrap materials, in which he also profits well.

To help him continue operations of his business, Anthony is requesting an amount of Php 30,000 in this loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Anthony hopes to increase his sources for making a living. He also wants to give his family a better life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 53 года, вдова, есть сын. Батма занимается торговлей продуктами питания в магазине возле ее дома на протяжении 15 лет. Стартовав с суммы 20,000 сом, на сегодняшний день Батма имеет товар в обороте на сумму 140,000 сомов (KGS) и ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 30,000 сомов (KGS). Батма в  целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для увеличение товарооборота, а именно покупку продуктов питания.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего торгового бизнеса.
texts.en: Batma is 53 years old and a widow with one son. She has managed a grocery store next to her house for 15 years. She started with 20,000 som (KGS) and now owns 140,000 som(KGS) worth of inventory and earns 30,000 som (KGS) monthly. Batma wants to expand her business and has tuned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use the money to expand her inventory to include new products so that she can increase the turn over of goods in her store. She will invest the profits from this expansion back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries so she can provide better variety for her customers

loans.name: Mary June

texts.en:
Mary June is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary June is forty-two years old and all of her children are in school.

Mary June's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost.

She is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Mary June has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Mary June would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college..

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Reina Ester

texts.es:
Reina, es una persona dedica a elaborar venta de tamales y realizar cultivo de granos básicos, vive con su familia, es casada y es madre de dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad; ya tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio, tiene 15 años de estar trabajando independiente, no tiene un horario definido.
Está solicitando ayuda con un crédito para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes y herbicidas, para cultivar maíz y frijol, alimentara mejor a su familia y tendrá parte de la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tamales, espera que su productividad sea mayor y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
Las aspiraciones de la Sra.: Reina son contar con recursos económicos con los que pueda mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, cancelar sus deudas, mejorar su negocio y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y convertirse en profesionales.
texts.en:
Reina is a person dedicated to making tamales to sell and growing basic grains. She lives with her family, is married, and is the mother of two children who are 3 and 6 years of age.  She already has a lot of experience in the business and has been working independently for 15 years.  She does not have a defined schedule.

She is requesting help with a loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and fertilizers and herbicides to grow corn and beans.  This will better feed her family and she will have part of the raw materials for making tamales to sell.  She expects that her productivity will be better and that she will have better economic stability.  

The aspirations of the señora Reina are to have economic resources with which to improve her living infrastructure, to pay off her debts, to better her business, and to support her children so that they can study and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and fertilizers and herbicides to grow corn and beans, to better feed her family.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, ages 2 and 5. She is engaged in selling processed foods like hot dogs and sausages. Her husband earns an additional income through a motorcycle transport business.

Robelyn is asking for a loan to pay for motorcycle repairs and to buy more stock of processed goods, like hot dogs and sausages. A loan will help her improve her business.

In the future, Robelyn dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's future schooling.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repairs and to buy more stock of processed goods, like hot dogs and sausages.

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.ru:
Сайёре 29 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Сайёра с семьей проживает на районе Кубадиён. Кубадиён расположен на южной стороне Таджикистана и считается одно из самых теплых мест в Республики. Сайёра является преподавателем в местной школе, также в свободное время она заминается продажей продуктов питания.
   Сейчас Сайёре необходимо сделать ремонт дома. Она боится, что их дом может не выдержит зиму и собирает средства, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Но Сайёра понимает, что зима не за горами, и за короткое время ей не удастся собрать надобную сумму и видит выход из положения только в получении кредита. Сайёра верит, что найдутся люди, которые помогут ей и не откажут в кредите.
texts.en: Sayyora is 29 years old. She is married with children. Her family lives in Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan. Qubadiyon is in the south and is one of the warmest areas in the country. Sayyora is a teacher in the local school and she also sells groceries. Currently Sayyora needs to repair her family's home. She is worried that the house will not survive another winter, so she has been saving money to pay for the essential repairs. However, winter is coming soon, before she will have collected the entire sum, so she feels it is necessary or her to take out a loan. Sayyora believes that there will be people willing to help her and her loan will not be refused.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for home repair

loans.name: Narzikhol

texts.ru:
Нарзихол является 59-летней швеей. Она проживает в районе Рудаки с мужем, сыновьями и невестками. Ее муж занимается растениеводством, а сыновья в настоящий момент работают в России. Сама Нарзихол у себя дома занимается шитьем. Она уже 15 лет как берет заказ на пошив женских национальных платьев и является известной швеей в своем селе. Невестки тоже усердно помогают в деятельности свекрови, потому что у нее всегда много заказов. Из-за старой швейной машинки процесс шитья Нарзихол сейчас доставляет много хлопот. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку для устранения этих неполадок и расширения своей деятельности. 
Ваша поддержка ей очень важна.
texts.en: Narsikhol is a 59 year old seamstress. She lives in Rudaki region with her husband, sons and daughters-in-law. He husband is a farmer and her sons are migrant workers in Russia. Narzikol herself sews from home. She has been making national Tajik costumes for 15 years and is a famous seamstress in her village. Her daughters-in-law diligently help out as well, as the shop receives a lot of orders. As the sewing machine is very old, Narzikol has been having a lot of problems. She turned to KIVA for a loan so that she can purchase a new sewing machine and expand the shop. Your support is very important to her!

loans.use: top purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Noe Misael

texts.es:
Noé, está mejorando su negocio con la ayuda proporcionada atreves del financiamiento anterior, aumento su ganado y utilizo otra parte para el cultivo de maíz, su nueva situación económica le da oportunidad de cultivar maíz para consumo familiar y zacate para alimentar a su ganado.
Por lo que se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca parida, continuara con el mejoramiento de la ganadería, aumentando la producción de los derivados de la aleche y generando mejores ingresos con los que pueda cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Noé is improving his business through the help provided by his last loan. He increased the size of his herd and used the other part to grow corn. His new financial situation allows him to grow corn for his family's consumption, and hay for his cattle.

For this reason, Noé decided to request a new loan to invest in the purchase of a newborn calf. He will continue improving his herd, increasing his production of milk-derived products, and earning more income with which he'll be able to pay his debts.

loans.use: to purchase a newborn calf.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 36 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years. 

Arlene requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 2 hijos, reside con su familia en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella ha decidido tener su propia fuente de ingresos y estableció una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar. Este negocio lo estableció hace año y medio, Anteriormente trabajó en una maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió por el negocio. Vende refrescos, huevos , manteca, arroz, azúcar, sal, condimentos, dulces, churros, pan, productos de abarrotería como papel higiénico, productos de limpieza, etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 7,500 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de refrescos, huevos, pan, churros, jugos, y otros que necesite para vender en su negocio y mantener sus ventas. Su plan es tener el negocio mas grande para apoyar a su familia y mas a futuro poder comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 33-year old woman who lives with her husband and their 2 children. They live in a suburban community in San Pedro Sula. She has her own income source running a grocery store, a business that she started 1.5 years ago and that sells basic products. She used to work in a factory, but lost her job and decided to start her own business. She sells sodas, eggs, butter, rice, sugar, salt, condiments, sweets, churros, bread and hygienic products such as toilet paper, cleaning items, etc. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,500 lempiras. She plans to use the loan to buy sodas, eggs, bread, churros, juices and other products to stock her store and keep its sales. Her goal is to expand the business so that she can support her family and buy a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy sodas, eggs, bread, churros, juices and other products to stock her grocery store and keep its sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for his dry cleaning store

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Rosario está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her family. For the past 8 years she has prepared and sold tortillas from her home, and she has many clients. 

Rosario is requesting a loan to purchase quicklime and hundred-kilo bags of corn. With this she will be able to continue making tortillas and increasing her income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase quicklime and hundred-kilo bags of corn.

loans.name: Buaisha

texts.ru: Буайша, 63 года, замужем, многодетная мать 4 детей. Буайша в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1983 году. Благодаря упорному труду Буайши в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 4 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,8 ГА, где Буайша выращивает кукурузу, арбузы и рис для реализации оптовым покупателям. Буайша в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коровы и 6 овец для разведения. Доходы от кредита она вложит в расширение бизнеса и постройку теплого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Buaisha is 63 years old, married and a mother of four. She raises livestock and farms as a primary source of income for her family, having started back in 1983. Due to determination and hard work Buaisha now owns 4 cows, 4 sheep, as well as 1.8 hectars (4.5 acres) of land where she grows corn, watermelons and rice for sale. Buaisha wants to expand her farm, so she has turned to "Bari-Tushum" for a loan. She will use the 150,000 som (KGS) loan to purchase 2 more cows and 6 sheep for breeding stock. Buaisha will invest the profits from this expansion back into the farm and wants to build a heated barn for her animals.|

loans.use: to purchase two cows and six sheep for  business expansion

loans.name: Kyabyakwaga Farmers Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a forty-three-year-old woman and married with three children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been growing and selling maize for many years in the rural areas. She obtains additional income from a retail shop selling fresh foods. 

She started her business to diversify her income and to produce surplus for the market. She is faced with the lack of capital to pay for the weeding of her maize plantation. 

Agnes is a member of a village bank where members guarantee each other to get a loan. She is requesting a loan to pay labor costs for the weeding of her maize plantation.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for the weeding of her maize plantation.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 70% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain underserved by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Justus, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest father who is 39 years of age. He hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He is the proud father of 4 lovely, school-going children. He loves and treasures his children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. His primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures he has been able to earn a decent income. 

He is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout he has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble dad has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". He faces financial challenges, and because the Nandi Hills area has proven a ready market for cereals, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereal for re-sale and thus improve his income. 

Justus' upbringing was challenging, and he has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling dad has been making great improvements, and he believes that through your loan he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Justus has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. He intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from his business. Justus is quite visionary and - with his accumulated profits - hopes he will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost his income and completely turn his life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 39, is a tea farmer from Kaasa 1, Igara. He started his business in 2008 and has managed to sustain his family of four children, ages 15, 13, 11 and 8 years old. All the children are attending school at the moment. He is married and also trades in green tea leaves as an additional source of income to support his children.

John has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy fertilizers and green tea leaves for the tea plantation. He is a hardworking man, who works for 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. His clients are tea traders and factories. Their continued support and his tireless efforts have enabled him to grow. John is faced with the challenge of the poor weather of the dry season, which affects his tea farming, but has learnt to manage it. His hope is to be financially stable for a better future. He applauds the Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers for his tea farm

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina has been involved in making blocks since 2013. She started her business with her own working capital of $250. Severina has a place in her house to make blocks. So now she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. And with this loan she wants to buy more materials, including sand, gravel, cement and other materials. 

She is happy because, with this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and with this she can know how to improve a management for one business.

loans.use: To buy sand, gravel, cement and other materials.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad, trabaja elaborando papas fritas en su domicilio con ayuda de su familia para posteriormente repartirlas a las tiendas para las cuales elabora. Trinidad tiene el riesgo de sufrir quemaduras 
Trinidad necesita un credito con urgencia pues el muro de su cocina se esta cayendo y necesita hacer la refaccion urgentemente 

Trinidad ahora es divorciada y es la unica fuente de ingresos para sus dos hijos con los cuales vive en la ciudad de La Paz. Ella goza de buena salud y esta dispuesta a trabajar mas duro
texts.en:
Trinidad works making french fries at her house to sell them to the stores later. Trinidad has the risk of suffering from burns and counts with her family to help her. 

Trinidad urgently needs a loan to repair the wall in her kitchen, which is falling down. Trinidad is divorced and this job is the only income source for her 2 children and their household in La Paz. She is healthy and ready to work harder.

loans.use: to urgently repair the wall of her kitchen, which is falling down.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 35-year-old man married to Seraphine, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Charles has been operating a transportation business for a period of two years, earning an income of 8,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Charles was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing his first loan of 15,000 KES. He intends to use this amount to repair his motorcycle, which has some mechanical challenges.

Charles plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle, which has mechanical challenges.

loans.name: Niso

texts.ru:
Нисо 34-летняя портниха родом из района Рудаки. Она замужем за торговца, у них растут четверо детей. Сыновьям по 12 и 4 года, а дочерям 10 и 11 лет. Все дети, кроме маленького сына учатся в школе. 
Нисо активная, шустрая и деятельная женщина. Она успевает и вести домашнее хозяйство и ухаживать за детьми и заниматься собственным швейным делом. 8 лет назад Нисо у себя дома открыла свой швейный бизнес. Ей нравится шить национальные женские одеяния и она получает от этого не только доход, но и наслаждение, ведь она занимается любимым делом. Сейчас Нисо решила расширить свою деятельность. Она на заемные средства хочет купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, а также необходимые ткани для шитья. Нисо нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Niso is a 34 years old seamstress from Rudaki region. She is married to a salesman and is raising four children. Her sons are 12 and 4 and her daughters are 10 and 11 years old. Everyone, except the youngest son, are attending school. Niso is an energetic and enterprising woman. She has time to take care of the house and her children and even run her own fashion business! She has opened her sewing home studio 8 years ago. Niso loves making traditional Tajik dresses and she not only gets profits, but also a lot of enjoyment from her business, as she is doing what she loves. Now, Niso wants to expand her studio. She wants to use this loan to purchase a modern sewing machine as well as more fabrics. Niso needs your help!

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been running the business for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Marilou requested an 11,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Marilou aspires to save money to build a warehouse.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a blacksmith's shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Mary Joy is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional materials like iron, charcoal, etc., for her blacksmith's shop business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like iron, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Glenda is 36 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Glenda's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business of buying and selling coconut wine and is committed to regaining what she lost.

Glenda is taking out a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Glenda has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mercedez works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Mercedez is borrowing 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Mercedez has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is an 18-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies information technology. His cousin works as an employee and helps Ahmad to pay the education expenses he has.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to use special engineering programs to do his homework and reports.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean people who make a living off of the land, and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Benjamin, a 61-year-old mixed farmer based in Koyo, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. Benjamin is a proud father of two lovely school-going children whom he truly loves and greatly adores. Benjamin describes his upbringing as challenging, so he is doing everything in his power to provide a good foundation for his children and to help secure their future.

Benjamin is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the 30,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan, he is going to spend to pay for a truckload of manure and also pay for seedlings.

He has been farming for nearly two decades. He is going to use your loan investment and the years of experience he has gathered to make this expansion a success. 

Money gathered from this investment will enable Benjamin to contribute to his family's general expenses, his children's education and medical needs.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Joyce operates a business selling poultry, which has been operational for over four years. She mentions disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Joyce dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda is the age of 41; she is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an impressive tone, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers.

Saeed's husband's general store is very famous in town; that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Saeeda requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Saeeda thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's general store

loans.name: Ignacia Rafaela

texts.es: Ignacia vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para vehículos su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposo logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de lubricantes por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ignacia lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. She works selling lubricants for vehicles. Her business is located near her house, in an area where many cars go through. This is why she has many customers. With her sales she helps her husband move ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy lubricants at wholesale prices in order to continue with her job and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy lubricants at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Cephers

texts.en:
Cephers is 43 years old, married and, together with his spouse, blessed with five children. He runs a video show business and has been in this business for 10 years now. He also charges for football viewing and the business has been profitable. Besides this he also has a barber shop.

He will be using this loan to buy more of the latest movies and documentaries for viewing by his customers and thereby get more income in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to expand his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of movies and documentaries.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Medarda requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like shells, wire, etc., for her business.

Medarda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like shells, wire, etc., for her business

loans.name: Pedrina

texts.es:
Pedrina de 35 años de edad, es una mujer muy valiente que ha tenido que hacerse cargo de sus tres hijos,  debido a que su esposo falleció hace ya un tiempo y de esta manera ha tenido que luchar trabajando de distintas cosas; así como empleada doméstica o comerciante pero según como ella dice gracias a Dios ella ha logrado salir adelante hasta el día de hoy sus hijos no están estudiando de momento ya que prefieren trabajar en las labores del campo para aportar aunque sea un poco para las cuentas de la casa.

Ella hasta el día de hoy se ha desempeñado en diferentes labores, pero es el día de hoy que ha decidido montar un nuevo negocio en el cual piensa aprovechar un poco mejor su talento en la cocina mediante una pupuseria que esta ubicada en la casa de su mamá y ella ve en esta oportunidad lo que necesita  para que sus hijos vuelvan a la escuela

Pedrina piensa invertir en la compra de los principales materiales para comenzar su pupuseria los cuales son frijoles, maíz, chicharrones, entre otras cosas, hay un par de cosas que ella ya posee como lo son la cocina donde va a hacer las pupusas, sillas y mesas que ya tiene es así como ella piensa comenzar su negocio.

Ella dice que cree tener la oportunidad de tener una pupuseria muy fuerte donde no solo lleguen a comprar las personas de la comunidad sino más bien que lleguen personas de las comunidades aledañas, así como gente de la ciudad, ella es muy optimista y no está de más decir que es ese optimismo es lo que le ha llevado a poder llevar una vida cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Pedrina is 35 years old. She is a very brave woman who has had to take charge of her three children because her husband passed away a while ago. She has had to work in various jobs, as a domestic worker, as a merchant. But, as she says, thanks to God, she has been able to make ends meet. Her children aren't studying at this moment in time because they prefer to work in the fields so they can contribute, though it may be only a little, for the household expenses.

She has worked in different jobs, but she has now decided to start a new business that will take better advantage of her talents in the kitchen. She'll have a pupusa [thick corn tortilla with various fillings] business, located in her mother's house. She sees in this opportunity what she needs for her children to return to school.

Pedrina plans to invest in the purchase of the main ingredients to start her pupusa business, which are beans, corn, and pork, among other things. There are a few things that she already owns, such as the kitchen where she'll make the pupusas, also chairs, and tables. This is how she plans to start her business. 

She says she thinks she has the opportunity to have a very strong pupusa business, where not only people from the community will come to buy, but also people from nearby communities, and also people from the city. She is very optimistic, and it would not be overstating things to say that it is this optimism that has helped her to have a life that is a little better each day.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, and pork, among other things, for making pupusas [thick corn tortillas with various fillings].

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 31 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nida has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buy and sell medicines and pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Cielo

texts.en:
Gloria Cielo is 30 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Gloria Cielo has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is married with children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a boutique and started the business to meet his family's needs. He earns a side income from tailoring. 

Richard is hardworking and hopes to expand his business but is faced with the challenges of having a small capital base and high costs in debt recoveries. He intends to use this loan to buy clothes to sell this festive season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this festive season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 43, is a hardworking woman. She is married to Sila, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with four children.

Mary operates a charcoal sales stall, which has been in operation for five years. Her business earns her an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings at the end of every month.

Mary was recently introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing her first loan, of 20,000 KES. She intends to buy additional charcoal to sell to her customers on a daily basis. She also plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children.

She hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy additional charcoal to sell daily to her customers.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, con el préstamo anterior conto con recursos económicos con los que pudo adquirir insumos agrícolas para mejorar la productividad de granos básicos, comenta que su cosecha fue abundante y de calidad, abasteció a su familia y a sus clientes, su situación económica ha tenido una leve mejoría.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y gallinas indias, seguirá cultivando maíz y frijol, además aumentara los animales de la granja, se esfuerza para continuar trabajando y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Victor had financial resources with which he could obtain farming supplies to improve the productivity of his staple grains. He says that he had an abundant and high-quality harvest. He supplied his family and his clients. His financial situation has improved slightly.

He is requesting a new loan to buy farming supplies and Indian hens. He will continue to grow corn and beans and will also increase the number of animals on his farm. He strives to continue working and get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and Indian hens so he can continue planting corn and beans and increase the number of animals on his farm.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 44-year-old married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother for three sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in a hotel where he gets a low income. 

One year ago, Muna opened a restaurant where she sells light sandwiches and drinks in the city. It is a very good business and the income is good.

Muna took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant. By taking this loan, Muna will be able to store more food instead of buying small amounts.

Muna appears in the photo in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, es un  señor que se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al destazo de (reses y cerdos) como actividades principales para subsistir con su familia, trabaja todos los días en las actividades relacionadas con la ganadería, mientras que el destazo lo realiza el día domingo, de esta manera aprovecha el día de comercio en su comunidad; Rafael vive con su compañera de vida y su nieto de 22 años de edad, ambos dependen económicamente de él, sus hijos ya son independientes.
Necesita de un préstamo para comprar reses y cerdos para mantener la continuidad del destazo, aprovechara la buena temporada de precios accesibles de los animales, espera aumentar sus ventas y recuperar lo invertido con mejores ganancias, así podrá cancelar su deuda sin ningún problema.
Sus proyectos son mantenerse trabajando para dar a su familia una vida más digna y enseñar a su nieto la administración del negocio.
texts.en:
Rafael raises and butchers cattle and pigs as the main way of supporting his family. He works every day in activities related to raising animals, while he butchers on Sundays. In this way he takes advantage of the market day in his town. Rafael lives with his partner and his grandson, who is 22 years old. Both are economically dependent on him. His children are independent.

He needs a loan to buy cattle and pigs so he can continue butchering without interruption in the schedule. He will take advantage of the season's good prices for the animals. He expects to increase his sales and recover what he invests with improved profits. In this way he'll be able to cancel his debt without any problems. 

His plans are to continue working to give his family a more dignified life and to teach his grandson to administer the business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs so he can continue butchering without interruption in the schedule.

loans.name: Déla

texts.fr: Déla âgée de 36 ans est née à Lomé de nationalité togolaise. Delà est mariée et mère d'un enfant, elle est revendeuse du riz, maïs et du haricot et habite le quartier Avédji .Déla a commencé son activité en 2008 et s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois a Aniè, ville située à 190 kilomètres de Lomé, et dans la localité d'Amouzoukondji. Delà sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son activité et acheter 2 sacs de riz et 40 bols du haricot. Elle vit dans une maison a location couvert de tôle avec de Electricité. Avec ce revenu, elle peut  soigner son enfant en cas de maladie.
texts.en: Déla is 36 years old. She was born in Lomé and has Togolese nationality. Déla is married and has one child. She sells rice, corn and beans and lives in the Avédiji neighborhood. Déla launched her business sin 2008. She stocks up twice a month in Anié, a town 190 km [118 miles] from Lomé, and in the Amozoukondji region. Deli is seeking this loan to expand her business by buying two bags of rice and 40 bowls of beans. She lives in a rented house which has metal sheet roofing and an electricity connection. She will use her revenue to cover  healthcare expenses for her child in case of illness.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice and 40 bowls of beans for resale so as to save money for healthcare expenses.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 54 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of curtains business in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional curtains to sell for her business.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the curtain business for 10 years and also earns an income from making seat covers.

Lilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional curtains to sell for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with kids and lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Margaret operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alexi Maricela

texts.es:
Alexi, ha mejorado su negocio, con la ayudad del financiamiento anterior mejoro la ganadería, mantiene la crianza de cerdos y a incluido el cultivo de maíz y maicillo, de esta manera alimenta mejor a su familia y el ganado.
En esta oportunidad requiere de capital para invertir en insumos agrícolas, que servirán para obtener una mejor cosecha de maíz y maicillo, espera mantener el buen desarrollo de su negocio y mejorar cada día la alimentación familiar.
texts.en:
Alexi has improved her business. With the help of the previous loan, she improved her livestock. She continues to raise pigs and also cultivates corn and sorghum. This is how she feeds her family and her livestock.

At this time she needs capital to purchase agricultural inputs, which will help her to have a better corn and sorghum harvest. She hopes to continue the healthy development of her business and improve her family's diet each day.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, which will help her to have a better corn and sorghum harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 5 años, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él está solicitando un crédito para al compra de redes y trasmallos ya que los que tiene están muy deteriorados, para continuar  con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been hidden for his own safety is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He has worked in fish farming for some 5 years. He sells his production in different markets and now has established customers. The young man lives in his own house with his life's companion and their two children. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase new fish nets and trammel-nets since his present nets have deteriorated. He needs new nets to continue his work, since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets and trammel-nets for his fish farming work.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 48-year-old cattle trader who has done trade in cattle for the last 20 years. He works six days in a week and works 12 hours per day. The business is located in rural Bushenyi, and his clients are mainly cattle traders in the same area. In addition to the cattle trade, Eric also does some agriculture, which boosts his income greatly. 

He would like to use the loan money to buy cattle for trade so that he can make improved profits in the festive season of December. His main challenge is limited capital. That is the reason why he has decided to borrow money, so that he can improve his business and be able to earn more profits. 

Eric describes himself as hardworking and honest, attributes which have helped him to attain profits. He hopes to be financially stable in the next few years. He is indebted for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises tiene 52 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hijo, desde hace varios años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de sus productos, Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar cemento por mayor y todas las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de dicho trabajo, y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ulises is 52 years old and lives in his own house with his son. For several years he has made and sold bricks. He has many clients because of the quality of his products. He is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy cement and all of the tools necessary in order to do this work. In this way he will earn better profits and be able to give his son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement and all of the necessary tools for making bricks.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, vive con su hijo de 3 años de edad, está acompañada; como fuente de ingresos posee una venta de tortillas, distribuye su producto entre sus vecinos, el negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, lo que la da como ventaja que no paga alquiler y cuida de su hijo.
Comprará leña, dos comales y maíz, equipara su negocio y contara con materia prima con la podrá seguir trabajando, espera mejorar sus ingreso, atraer nuevos clientes y brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
María sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener dependientes que le ayuden con la venta y  resarcir la deuda.
texts.en:
María lives with her 3-year-old son and is married. As a source of income, she has a business selling tortillas. She distributes her products among her neighbors. Her business is located in her home, which gives her the advantage of not having to pay for rent or for someone to watch her son.

She will buy firewood, 2 griddles, and corn to equip her business and have raw materials so she can continue working. She hopes to improve her income, attract new clients, and provide her family with a better lifestyle.

María dreams of expanding her business, having assistants to help her with selling, and repaying her debt.

loans.use: to buy firewood, 2 griddles, and corn to equip her business and have raw materials so she can keep working.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Mariposas de Vista hermosa La señora Hilda se dedica a la confección de blusas para damas en diferentes tallas, colores, calidad y estilos, desde hace 16 años.  Con la ayuda de su esposo y el apoyo amoroso de sus dos hijos sigue luchando por su mayor sueño, llegar a ser una gran distribuidora de su aldea y llegar a exportar sus blusas algún día al extranjero, también tener un local propio a orillas de la calle principal  para darse a conocer y distribuir en el mismo lugar. Las fechas de venta se aproximan y los pedidos de blusas están creciendo.  Actualmente tiene un pedido bastante grande pero la tela que tiene no le alcanza y necesita comprar más, también el dinero no le es suficiente y por ese motivo nuevamente solicita un crédito para poder comprar rollos de tela en diferentes colores y tipos de tela ya que utiliza tela de algodón, licra, a cuadros  y popelina, con un valor de Q. 1,500.00 cada rollo.  No quiere fallarles a sus clientes ni quedarles mal por ello pide el préstamo.  Su compañera la señora Jeimy de 24 años de edad.
texts.en:
Hilda has been making different sizes, colors, quality, and styles of women’s blouses for 16 years.  With her husband’s help and the loving support of her two children, she continues struggling for her biggest dream.  That is to come to be a great distributor in her village and to someday export her blouses abroad.  She also dreams of having her own place on the edges of the main street in order become known and to distribute in the same place.  The sales dates are coming, and the orders for blouses are growing.

She currently has a very big order, but she does not have enough fabric.  She needs to buy more, but she does not have enough money.  That is the reason that she is requesting a loan again.  She will use the loan to buy rolls of different colors and types of fabric.  She uses cotton, lycra, plaid, and poplin that sell for 1,500 quetzals per roll.  She does not want to let her customers down or leave a bad impression.  That is why she is requesting the loan.

Her colleague, Jeimy, is 24 years old.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Mariscal De Vilaque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARISCAL DE VILAQUE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Benigna es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, servicio de internet, artesana en mantas, venta de abarrotes, venta de carne.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Benigna es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, ya que el mismo fue una necesidad de sus vecinos lo que aprovecho para emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Mariscal de Vilaque comunal bank will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Benigna is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank engage in are varied and include selling food, neighborhood store, Internet service, handmade blankets, selling groceries, and selling meat.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Benigna is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago by invitation from an adviser with the institution who went to visit her at her home.  She currently has a grocery store business.  She says that she learned this business several years ago.  Her neighbors needed it, and she took advantage of this need in order to undertake this business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy groceries).  She will get the groceries from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  She will later sell them at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 44 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, shampoo, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, cereals, etc., to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, cereals, etc. 

Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, shampoo, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, cereals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joan is 43 years old and all of her children are in school.

Joan has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Joan has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she an afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cereals, and also the energy drinks that the men of the town have been requesting so can they do their work in the rural areas.

loans.name: Muhammad Shakeel

texts.en:
Muhammad Shakeel, 39, is married and the father of seven children. He owns an automobile showroom. He is hardworking and polite. 

Due to the large size of his family, he sometimes faces problems with fulfilling his family's requirements. Yet, he has managed to develop a good network of clients and he earns enough to meet their regular expenses. 

To increase business, Muhammad Shakeel wants to buy another automobile for his showroom to attract more customers. Due to insufficient financing, he has requested a loan to buy the automobile. 

This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new automobile for his showroom.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, in her late 40s, is married with four children who are still in school. She has been running several projects: growing and selling broiler chickens, selling clothes and shoes and selling dried foods, like sugar, beans, wheat flour, baking flour, cooking oil, salt and tea leaves.  

She has been in her business for six years. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Lucy's ninth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chicks and open a shop. She is doing fine and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She has used her profits to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, build her house and cover household expenses. 

Lucy will use this loan to buy chicken feed and chicks to raise into layers. She will make sure that she pays her loan according to the loan schedule.

She dreams of building a rental property.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks to raise into layers.

loans.name: Pink Rose Group

texts.en:
Pilly, who is in her early 40s, is single with two children who are still in school.  She has been running a beauty salon for six years now. She works from 8 am to 9.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Pilly's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy salon products.  She dreams of owning an international salon.  

Pilly will share this loan with her loan group "PINK ROSE", which has a total of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde a la agricultura siembra maíz y pipián, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, tiene muchos clientes, vive con su compañera de vida y su hija en casa propia, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos
texts.en: This young man's face has been blurred because he is 21 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He works in agriculture and has corn and squash crops. He sells his products in the neighboring towns. He has many customers. He lives in his own house with his life partner and daughter. This young man is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc., to continue with his work and have higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Norqueza

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Norqueza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing and farming coconuts.  Norqueza is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Norqueza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel is a hardworking entrepreneur who been buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines for five years now. She  earns additional income  selling ready-to-wear clothing and operating a motorcycle transport service.

Licel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Having repaid her previous loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish for her enterprise.

Licel dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Odi

texts.es:
Odi es estudiante, también trabaja en un estudio Jurídico como asistente en la ciudad de Santaní, es una persona, honesta, trabajadora, responsable y muy dedicada a sus estudios.
Está estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, y se está esforzando mucho para poder ser un gran profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y así seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Odi is a student, but he also works as an assistant at a law firm in the city of Santaní. He is an honest, hardworking, and responsible individual who is dedicated to his studies. Odi is studying for a degree in Accounting Sciences and is trying very hard to become a successful professional.

He is requesting this loan in order to pay his fees, which will allow him to continue his studies as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is a 45-year-old married cloth weaver with five children living in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been a weaver since 2010, earning $5 daily. Her husband is 43 and he is a construction worker earning $10 per day. Three of her children are students and one is a worker earning $6 per day.

Now Vanna would like to request a loan to buy farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her improve her family’s finances. In the future, she is going to support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon and also for sale.

loans.name: Maita

texts.en:
Maita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years now.

Maita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura (siembra maíz) desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated because he is 24 years old and lives in a high danger zone has worked in agriculture (growing corn) for a number of years. He sells his products in the different markets that are near his home. He lives in his own house with his mother. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc., and improve the land that is shown in the photograph to be able to continue with his work and have better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: “When people come together, they are powerful,” says Dominic, a 33-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Magenche in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. As a young boy, he watched women in his village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led him to join the Marindi self-help group. For the past eight years, he has bred more than two dairy cows, developed his farm, and planted and sold a variety of crops. He says the secret to his success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also helps.
