Dominic was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that his family faced. However, he never gave up and he has been practicing farming. Dominic always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming; it runs in my blood.” Because of how much he likes farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows “Boxy”, which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. Through his dairy cow, he is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps him support his family. Dominic also practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Dominic is a visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through the lenders’ help and goodwill. Dominic believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his children a solid educational background. This loan will be Dominic’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Thủy is 32 years old and married with one child. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in her business for eight years.

The main hardship that Thủy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and other equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and other equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Muchachitas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUCHACHITAS DE ORO” iniciará el vigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Natividad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, compra de vehículos, venta de regalos, venta de repuestos de automóviles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Natividad es integrante, ella indica que hace once años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el primer crédito que le otorgaron en Pro Mujer, mismo que le ayudo a emprender un negocio independiente, en la actualidad cuenta con un puesto fijo y comercializa al por mayor. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las cultivadoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará por mayor en la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank the 'Muchachitas de Oro" (Golden Girls) are about to start their twenty-first loan cycle as part of the Pro Mujer Regional Office. The group is made up of eight members and is governed by a board of trustees with Natividad as the president. The members run a variety of businesses in the following fields: selling cosmetics, selling vegetables, buying vehicles, selling gifts and selling replacement car parts. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro businesses that Natividad is involved in. She tells us that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eleven years after being invited to join by an assessor from the institution who paid her a visit at home. At the moment she runs a business selling vegetables; she makes it publicly known that she started this business using the first loan that she got from Pro Mujer, the same loan which helped her to start a separate business. At present she has a permanent stall and sells wholesale goods. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to buy a bigger stock of vegetables from the wholesale farmers in the city of La Paz which she will later sell wholesale in the city of La Paz. This type of work allows her to make an income to support her family economically. She is married and has three children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health service, training and loans offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Dian

texts.en:
Dian works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a buy and sell of crabs business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,350 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Dian is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Maideen

texts.en:
Maideen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines for six years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Maideen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF; she is now borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell such as eggplant, tomatoes, radishes, string beans, etc. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell such as eggplant, tomatoes, radishes, string beans, etc.

loans.name: Fé Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Nohemí de 20 años de edad, acompañada, y su negocio es comerciante de ropa en su domicilio, desde hace dos años, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa, tanto de hombre como de mujer tales como: camisetas, pantalones, blusas, etc. Flor tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y variedades; Lucia tiene 33 años donde su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos y Lillian tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es vender fritanga en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en: This group is made up of four successful entrepreneurial members, one of them is Nohemí, 20 years old, partnered, and her business is selling clothing from her home. She has done this for the past two years, this loan will be invested in purchasing packets of clothing, both for men and women such as shirts, pants, blouses, etc. Flor is 41 years old and her business is selling clothing and other products, Lucia is 33 years old and her business is selling clothes and cosmetics and Lillian is 20 years old and her business is selling fried food from her home, which she has done for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase packets of clothing, both for men and women such as shirts, pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Collanas De Uyuni Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLLANAS DE UYUNI” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tejidos, tejido de mantas, pastelería, venta de comida, venta de piezas de autos, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que hace once años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de autos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió recientemente, al contar con pequeño capital y con la guía de su familia, cuenta que cambio de rubro de negocio pues ya no era muy rentable. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de repuestos de autos por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “COLLANAS DE UYUNI” communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of its Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board for which Vicenta is the president. The businesses the members of the communal bank have undertaken are varied and among them are sales of woven products, blanket weaving, making cakes, food sales, car part sales, salchipapas (sausage with french fries) sales, and clothing sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners, of whom Vicenta is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eleven years ago, joining at the invitation of a staff member of the institution who went to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling car parts.  She states that she undertook this business recently, having a small amount of capital and with the guidance of her family; she says that she changed the type of her business because it wasn't very profitable.  

The loan that she now is taking out is to increase her capital (purchase car part is bulk) that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and later will sell them in her sales space. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center, the training, and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase car parts in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Yanira

texts.es: Luz de 36 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos (yuca, papas fritas, enchiladas, pastelitos de carne, etc.) su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más materia prima como: yuca, papas, maíz, verduras, carne, etc. y así continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz is 36 years old and lives with her life partner and their four children in their own house. She works selling snacks (yucca, french fries, enchiladas, small meat pastries, etc.). Her business is located near her house; with the sales that she makes, she manages to get ahead with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase more raw material such as yucca, potatoes, corn, vegetables, meat, etc. and in this way continue with her work to have a better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase yucca, potatoes, corn, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Samuel sigue teniendo horarios exigentes pero ahora tiene un tiempo extra, continúa trabajando en una empresa privada y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia ya que vive con su madre que esta delicada de salud y es mayor de edad.
Samuel quiere credito para invertir en estudios superiores en el area de sistemas de seguridad. Samuel goza de buena salud y tiene muchas ganas de estudiar
texts.en:
Samuel is single and doesn't have any children. He lives in his mother's house, occupying just one room. The house is located in the city of La Paz.

Samuel continues having a demanding schedule but now he has some extra time. He will continue working in a private business and with what he earns, he should cover the costs of food and to pay basic utility costs for his family since he lives with his mother who is in poor health and is older.

Samuel wants a loan to invest in higher education in the area of security systems. Samuel enjoys good health and has a great desire to study.

loans.use: to invest in higher education in the area of security systems.

loans.name: Jenoveva

texts.en: Jenoveva is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop selling second hand clothes. She started to do this business a few month ago with her own working capital of $500. She wants to buy more second hand clothes but her working capital is not enough so Jenoveva had an idea to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more second hand clothes including T-shirts, shorts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts and other clothes to sell. Jenoveva is earning a good income from selling her second hand clothes because many people like to buy them. They are cheap and unique when compared to new clothes.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, shorts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 51 years old and has eight children. She is a married woman.

Janet and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Janet is taking out a housing loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Janet has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Janet can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is a careful mother of two children. She lives together with her two children and husband in her own house. Nargis is a sewer. She sews a variety of national women's dresses. She provides these services in her house. Nargis has been busy with this business for more than five years. She is going to repair her house because her house is in bad condition. She plans to repair her workshop also and in this way, improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as paints, cement, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as paints and cement to repair her house

loans.name: Snonoy Group

texts.en:
Snonoy is 21 years old, a married farmer with a child living in Prey Veng province of Cambodia. 

She has cultivated rice and fattened pigs since 2011, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a 29-year-old construction foreman earning approximately $10 per day. 

Now Snonoy, a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will provide her a hygienic living. 

In the future, she wants to run a small butcher’s shop selling pork at her house, renovate her house, and support her child to go to a university.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Dúo Luchar Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
DUO LUCHAR PARA TRIUNFAR
Doña Dora Fermana, es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 26 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la venta de delantales.
El esposo de ella trabaja en una finca exportadora de flores, y gracias al poyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que hace algunos años ella empezó su propio negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante ya que es el medio que tienen para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, comprar mas matera prima y elaborar otros estilos de güipiles. para tener mejores ganancias y asi mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor, ya que hoy en dia la educación es muy importante.su compañera es Isabel de 19 años de edad.
texts.en:
The LUCHAR PARA TRIUNFAR duo.
Dora Fermana is originally from Tecpan, Guatemala, she is 26 years old and in her responsibility are her three young children. She works hand weaving traditional patterns and selling aprons. 

Her husband works on a farm which exports flowers and, thanks to his support, she continues onward with her business; she began her own business some years ago and, thanks to God, little by little she has been able to get ahead since it is the means that she has to get ahead.

Her dream is to expand her business more, purchase more raw material, and make other styles of güipiles (traditional Guatemalan blouses) to have more income and in this way, send her children to school for a better future, since these days education is very important. Her partner is Isabel, who is 19 years old.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make and sell traditional weaving.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Two of them are adults and the youngest is 11.  Merlyn and her family live in Baybay, Leyte.

Merlyn has been in a hog raising business for five years now. To keep her business going, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more piglets and feed to keep the hogs healthy. With this, she will be able to expand her business and expect a better profit after four months. Merlyn dreamed of having another source of income someday to further improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is 49-years-old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 6 children. She does farming in the town of Kisumu where she grows maize, beans and vegetables for sell and she has been in the farming business for the past 12 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more pieces of land for farming.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Her name is Lea, 19, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Gilbert, a fisherman, she has one child who is at the nursery level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her child to school. 

Lea operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue the operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal , soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Lea hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She wants to give her child the best education until college. She prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling native bags in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Angie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more native bags to offer for sale.

Angie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more native bags to offer for sale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 60 years old and married with six children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Anita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en:
Mariane is 32 years old, married and has two children. 

Mariane is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Mariane has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mariane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42-years-old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, laundry soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Caridad requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Caridad has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana de 52 años de edad, vive muy cerca del cementerio general y de la principal escuela del municipio debido a esto ella decidió colocar un pequeño cafetín en el lugar; ya que es un lugar donde pasa mucha gente a diario, ella vive con su hija pero ninguna depende económicamente de la otra.

Ella tiene ya algún tiempo de tener su negocio y además también mantiene una venta de tortillas por el mediodía y la tarde para lo cual contrata a una amiga que le ayuda a desempeñar esta labor.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar más producto como bebidas y golosinas y también las flores alegóricas a la temporada para las personas que deciden ir a visitar a sus seres queridos que ya pasaron a otro plano espiritual.

Ana planea obtener unas excelentes ganancias en su negocio en el futuro próximo, pues ya se acercan las fiestas patronales y el día de finados, dos días en los que planea hacer buenos negocios.
texts.en:
Ana, 52 years old, lives very close to the general cemetery and to the main school in the municipality. Due to this, she decided to establish a small cafe in this place, since it is a place where many people go by daily. She lives with her daughter but no one else depends on her economically. 

She has had this business for some time, and in addition she also maintains tortilla sales at mid-day and in the evening for which she hires a friend who helps her do this work. 

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase more products such as drinks and candies, and also the allegorical flowers of the season for the people who decide to go to visit their loved ones who have passed on to another spiritual plane. 

Ana plans to get excellent earnings in her business in the near future, since the feast day of the local patron saint and All Souls' Day are approaching, two days on which she expects to have very good sales.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as drinks and sweets, and also the allegorical flowers of the season.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 23 years old. She is married to Maurice and together they have been blessed with 2 children of 4 and 2 years respectively.Maurice is employed and therefore provides additional income for his family.

Judith runs a salon, a business she has done for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000. She has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 30,000 which she will use to buy hair extensions, hair relaxers, hair oils and shampoos to be used in her salon business.

With the anticipated profits, Judith will be able to buy more salon stock as well as repay her loan. 

Judith hopes and dreams for the future is to have a stable income that is able to supply her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair relaxers, hair oils, and shampoo

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 30-year-old woman married to Andrew, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.

Peris has been operating a grocery stall business for a period of five years earning herself an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Peris was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing her first loan of 30,000 KES.  She intends to use this amount to buy cabbages, potatoes, onions, green vegetables and tomatoes to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Peris plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 30-year-old hardworking woman, married to Joseph, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Jane has been a farmer for a period of  six years, earning herself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Jane was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 and intends to use this amount to buy more farm fertilizers and animal feeds.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizers and animal feeds.

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en: Yeoun is a 43-year-old homemaker with three children living in a village in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. One of her children attends school. Her husband is 44, an electrician earning approximately $11 a day. Now Yeoun would like to request a loan to buy a cow to breed for calves to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to buy more cows to breed, build a kitchen and support her child to have a higher education.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed for calves to resell

loans.name: Phat Group

texts.en:
Phat is a 31-year-old married farmer with two small children living in a village in Prey Veng province of Cambodia. A farmer since 2003 earning $7 per day, she is married to a 28-year-old construction worker employed in Thailand and earning $10 a day. 

Now requesting a loan for the group of four that she leads, Phat will use her portion to build a latrine for the family. In the future, she wants to renovate her house, help her children go to university, and have her husband open a motorcycle repair stall in the city.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hard working entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 46 years old and has four children. She, together with her husband, breeds and raises pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures.

She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 in sales every month.

Emily is taking out PHP 20,000 loan assistance to buy additional hogs and feeds. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products and other materials which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, Emily hopes to grow her business and thus her earnings. She dreams that her children will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools to fix computers.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Loida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Loida is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Melecita

texts.en:
Melecita is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Melecita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melecita has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melecita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is widowed mother and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Gina is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of tobacco to resell.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tobacco to resell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, married, works hard to support her family. She has had a retail veterinary supplies business for 7 years.

Rosalie requested a 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional supplies to sell to her customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, manifiesta que gracias a créditos ha mantenido la venta de tamales, pan, enchiladas entre otros antojitos con vida, tiene nuevos clientes y ha mejorado la calidad de vida para sus hijos, pues hoy en día la alimentación que les brinda es mejor, también tienen más oportunidades de tener un mejor futuro.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar condimentos, harina, pollo, verduras, aceite, etc., para continuar elaborando la venta de antojitos, el resto lo invertirá en insumos agrícolas para cultivar media manzana de maíz, esperando seguir teniendo resultados positivos.
texts.en:
Rosa says that, thanks to the loans, she has kept her business selling tamales, bread, and enchiladas, among other snacks alive, she has new customers, and has improved her children's quality of life, since these days the food that she offers them is better. They also have more opportunities to have a better future.

She has chosen to take out another loan to purchase seasonings, flour, chicken, vegetables, oil, etc., to continue making and selling snacks. The rest will be invested in agricultural products to cultivate a half manzana of corn, hoping to continue to have positive results.

loans.use: to purchase seasonings, flour, chicken, vegetables, oil, etc. to continue making and selling snacks.

loans.name: Uliks

texts.en:
Uliks is a Romani Albanian father of four young children, with 7 years old being the oldest and 1 being the youngest.  He sells used clothing to earn an income, and he buys these from the neighboring countries.

The reason why he is requesting this loan is to buy used items to resell.  “I have been doing this kind of activity for a long time now and it has been going well, so far.  I’ve been selling at the Roma market in our city; there is a lot of clientele and our market is considered the largest in Albania. Sometimes we sell brand new clothes, yet they are out of fashion in other countries and in fashion in our country,” said Uliks in the interview. 

Uliks and his family speak their own language as their first one and Albanian as a second language. Their family’s hobby is dancing.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to resell

loans.name: Vien

texts.en:
Vien is 24 years old and a student in the third year at a university.  His major is Law. He lives in Siem Reap province of Cambodia. He does not have the finances to afford tuition and  requests a loan to pay for his first-semester university fee. This loan will help him sto graduate. 

In the future, he is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary and help his parents.

loans.use: to pay for his first-semester university fee.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan es un hombre de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijas de diez y 6 años de edad, su negocio es el transporte como taxi.
Él es independiente, buen padre, constante, trabajador y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ caracterizado por su oferta de restaurantes de comida típica y su tradicional chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima semi-tropical.
Froilan es de tez morena, estatura alta, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español por el trabajo. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de comida y con sus hijas ambas estudian en la escuela primaria, todos viven en una casa de ladrillo a medio construir, con paredes de ladrillo y otras de adobe y cuentan con el servicio de luz y agua de pozo.
Su negocio es el transporte libre como taxi; ya lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad por lo que es conocido en el lugar, tiene clientes rutinarios, como algunas cocineras del mercado a las cuales transporta diariamente y también clientes casuales que transporta desde el mercado después de haber realizado sus compras cargadas de bolsas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa. Él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable para su baño, cocina y lavandería; y dejar de usar su pozo, para brindarle a su familia mayor comodidad y mejores condiciones higiénicas.
Es por esos motivos que Froilan solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones higiénicas.
texts.en:
Froilan is a 36 year old man, he lives with his partner and has 2 daughters, ages 10 and 6. His business is taxi transportation.

He is independent, a good father, reliable, hard-working and very responsible. He does his work in the area of "Sacaba", known for its offerings of typical  food and traditional chicha (fermented corn drink), with a semi-tropical climate. 

Froilan is tanned, tall, and has short black hair; his maternal language is Quechua and he speaks Spanish for work.  He shares his live with his partner who works selling food and with his daughters, both of whom are primary school students. They all live in a house made of brick, which in the process of being build, with some brick walls and others which are adobe, and which has electricity and well water. 

His business is transportation as a taxi driver; he has done this work for 18 years, so he is known in the area. He has regular customers, such some cooks in the market, who he drives daily, and also occasional customers who he transports from the market after they have made their purchases and are weighed down with bags. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. His dream is to finish building his house. He wants to set up the water connection for the bathroom, kitchen, and laundry, and stop using the well, to offer his family more comfort and better, more hygienic conditions.

For these reasons, Froilan asks for a loan to pay for the water connection and offer his family better, more hygienic conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the connection of water service and offer his family better, more hygienic conditions.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has a timber sells business in Kisumu town and has been running this business for 15 year. He is 37 years old, married and has been blessed with 3 children.

He will use this loan to buy  timber for sell and use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future, he hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy timber for sell.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương is 27 years old and she is married with one child.  She lives  in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for 4 years.                                                                                 
 
The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for a biogas system installation. 

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for biogas system installation.

loans.name: Jonavelle

texts.en:
Jonavelle is 22 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Jonavelle has a business selling native mats in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of native mats to resell.

Jonavelle has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of native mats to resell

loans.name: Marie Judelyn

texts.en:
Marie Judelyn is a 42-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marie Judelyn has had a fishing business for 20 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Marie Judelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn has run a general store for 3 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 57 years old and married with six children. 

Florentina is in the agricultural business and has raised livestock for 38 years. She requests 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

She has previously borrowed 19 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Florentina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Eurica

texts.en:
Eurica is a 46-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Eurica has a food vending business in the Philippines. Eurica requested a 5,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Eurica has been in this business for three years. In the future, Eurica would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima is a 46-year-old married woman with three children, 2 attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fima has had a food vending business for 2 years and requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Fima would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Wa'ad Group

texts.en:
Wa'ad is a group which consists of four women and a man. All the members of the group are very dynamic and active.  They live in the city of Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Huda is the leader of the group. She is a 35 year-old married woman with three children; they live in a small house. Their house is very cold, particularly these days because of the winter season.

Huda strives to provide her children with better living conditions, but the family's income  is very low and limited. Huda decided to renovate the house to make it warm and comfortable but she doesn't have enough money. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase construction materials to renovate the house.

Huda intends to build a second floor to make a comfortable house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate the inside of the house.

loans.name: Tacobamba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TACOBAMBA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alejandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de frutas, venta de frutas, tienda de barrio, venta de jugos.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alejandra es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta producción de fruta; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará a las vendedoras minoristas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The Tacobamba Communal Bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Regional Office. It is composed of nine members and it is led by a board of directors, of which Señora Alejandra is president.   The members of the communal bank are engaged in various businesses, among which are growing fruit, selling fruit, a neighborhood store, and selling juices. 


The loan that they are seeking will benefit the small businesswomen, of whom Señora Alejandra is a member.  She says that she is joining Pro Mujer for the first time, at the invitation of an advisor from the institution who came to visit her at her house.

Her business is growing and selling fruit.  She says that she learned this business from her parents, as she had helped with the family business ever since she was a little girl; and now that she has her own family, she has decided to start her own business.

The loan that she is seeking will be for increasing capital, namely, the purchase of wholesale seeds that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  Later on, she will sell her crop to retail vendors.  This form of work allows her to generate income in order to support her family, as she has a common-law-marriage, and a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale seeds.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 30 years old and married, with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. She has a manufacturing business sewing clothes and has been involved in this business for eight years.

The main hardship that Nhung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet.

loans.name: Tiến

texts.en:
Tiến is 24 years old and married, with one child. He lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. He is a driver and has been involved in this business for five years.  

The main hardship that Tiến faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet. This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With his business profit, Tiến hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy textile materials for making dresses to sell.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
O Sr. Sergio de 22 anos de idade casado e pai de um filho que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele e Operario Agricola na empresa de producao de Banana. 
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (pedra, area, cimento, barratos e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao.
texts.en: Sergio, age 22, is married and the father of one son who goes to elementary school.  He is an agricultural worker at a banana company. With this loan, he will buy construction materials (stone, gravel, cement, beams) and pay for hired labor so he can continue with improvements to his house. His major challenge is in improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, gravel, cement, beams) and pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Skin Success Group

texts.en:
Agnes, who is in her mid 30's, is a divorcee with one daughter who is still in school.  She has been hatching and selling chicks for two years now.  She works from 8 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Agnes's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy eggs and to pay for electricity used to hatch the eggs to make chicks.  She dreams of owning a big office for selling her chicks.  

Agnes will share this loan with her loan group Skin Success Group which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy eggs and to pay for electricity used to hatch the eggs to make chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, gravel, cement, beams) and pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia se dedica al negocio de venta de pescado, la socia vende pescado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pescado. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pescado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Alicia is in the fish-selling business. She sells fish from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. She has been in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business of selling fish. She is applying for the loan in order to buy fish.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Amylie

texts.en:
Amylie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, etc., for her general store business.

Amylie has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from raising pigs and farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Amylie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, etc

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
This group of women is part of the Greda loan group created January 11, 2013. It consists of women of the same faith who enjoy good relationships and are active in commerce (grocery, soft drinks, cosmetics, rice and beans).

Gifty, who is standing on the right in the picture, is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. She has been active in trading in groceries, soft drinks and cosmetics for a long time. 

She will use the loan to buy groceries, soft drinks and cosmetics at GHS 3000 for resale. The profits will enable her to bolster her business and also to take care of her children.

They need a total amount of GHS 3900 to expand their businesses and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Myzejen

texts.en: Myzejen just recently finished paying off the loan for her business and is requesting another loan, this time to furnish her home. Her promise to the lenders is that she will repay this loan on time as well. "We need to furnish our place; otherwise we will have no beds nor appliances to make our meals," said Myzejen. She thanks lenders for their previous financial help.

loans.use: to furnish her family home before winter starts

loans.name: Boavida

texts.pt:
O Sr. Boavida de 25 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele e Operador de Maquina  na empresa de producao de Banana a mais de 3  anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (pedra, area, cimento, barratos e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en: Boavida, age 25, is married and the father of two children who both attend elementary school.  He has worked as a machinery operator at a banana company for more than three years. With this loan, he will buy construction materials (stone, gravel, cement, beams) and pay for hired labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, gravel, cement, beams) and pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 25-year-old man married to Emily, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with one child.  

Peter operates a motorcycle transportation business which has been in operation for five years, earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Peter is now servicing his second loan of KES 30,000 and intends to use this amount to buy an additional motorcycle to serve his customers effectively.

Peter plans to use the anticipated income to add some stationery to his wife's bookshop and he hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Ermelita

texts.en:
This is Ermelita, 59, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Nestor, a tricycle driver and they have children.  She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Ermelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines. A variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ermelita dreams to expand her business. She hopes for success in life as well. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Ilda de 44 anos de idade, solteira  e mae de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino secundario e 2 sao independente. Ela è empacotadora de banana na empresa de producao de Banana a mais de 4 anos
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, area, janelas, portas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a contrucao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta alimentar da sua familia.
texts.en: Ilda, age 44, is a single mother of four children, two of whom are in high school and two of whom are independent. She has worked as a packer at a banana factory for more than four years. With this loan she will buy construction materials (cement, gravel, windows, doors) and pay for hired labor to begin construction on her house. Her major challenge is in improving her living conditions and her family's diet.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, gravel, windows, doors) and to pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 44 years old. He is married to Benter and together they have been blessed with 7 children, aged between 22 and 2 years old.

Jared has been in the transport business for 5 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000. However, he diversified into selling cereals as well.

Jared has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 30,000 which he will use to buy different kinds of dried cereals like maize, peas, green grams and cow peas for his new cereals store.

With the anticipated profits, Jared will be able to restock his cereals store as well as continue with his transport business.

Jared's hope and dream for the future is to have a stable income through his two businesses.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of dried cereals like maize, peas, green grams, cow peas etc.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 41 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell empty bottles business  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional empty bottles to sell for her business.

Estelita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future Estelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy additional empty bottles to sell for her business

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff of maize flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Mwaka dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Salve is 41 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Salve has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with two children, both of whom attend school. Her husband is a carpenter and he supports his family financially. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Halima operates a firewood business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and competition from other firewood operators in her business. 

With Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 60 years old and has eleven children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Isabel requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Isabel has been in pig-fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Samach

texts.en:
Samach is 21 and a married garment-factory worker with a small child from Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been working in a factory in the city since 2011. Her husband is 26 and a construction worker, earning approximate $5 daily. 

Samach is requesting a loan to buy lumber to renovate her house. This loan will help her have a nicer house. In the future, she wants to have a small shop for designing clothes.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a 29-year-old Ugandan woman. She is a single mother of two children who are 8 and 5 years old and attend school.

Her main source of income is transport; she has motorcycles that she hires out in order to earn a living and provide necessities for her children. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE to buy a motorcycle that will help her generate more income.

She dreams of constructing a residential house and having a family. Her transport business is challenged by bad weather and bad roads that occasionally lead to her motorcycles breaking down.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that will help her generate more income.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 53 años de edad, actualmente reside junto a su esposo y su hijo. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, su hijo actualmente estudia el bachillerato.

Margarita tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en el interior del Hospital Nacional en la cual ella vende golosinas con los pacientes y el personal médico de dicho centro asistenciario, a la vez ella también hace almuerzos en pequeñas cantidades para los empleados los cuales le piden estos mismos debido a la confianza que tienen en ella. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar bebidas, galletas, dulces, pan, pollo, verduras, maíz y condimentos para elaborar enchiladas. Ya que ha podido observar que la demanda de los productos que ella comercializa ha ido subiendo con el tiempo y planea darse así misma un empuje considerable con la pequeña solicitud que ha hecho.

Margarita dice que ella se ve construyendo su propio lugar para vender sus productos y de esta manera poder pagar los estudios universitarios de su hijo con las ganancias que su negocio le genere ella sabe que estará un poco difícil, ver graduado a su hijo pero también sabe que ha batallado toda su vida y está dispuesta a seguir dando la batalla.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 53-year old woman who lives with her husband and son. Her husband works as a builder and her son attends high-school. 

Margarita owns a small store located inside the National Hospital, where she sells candy to patients and health professionals. She also makes lunches in small quantities for the hospital employees, who really trust her. 

She is requesting a loan to buy beverages, cookies, sweets, bread, chicken, vegetables, corn and condiments to make enchiladas. The demand for her products has been increasing over time and she plans to expand the business. Margarita sees herself having her own space to sell her products and being able to pay for his son's college tuition. She knows that covering tuition with her earnings will be difficult, but she also knows that she has been fighting her whole life and is ready to keep doing so.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cookies, sweets, bread, chicken, vegetables, corn and condiments to make enchiladas.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
A Sra Amelia de 42  anos de idade, solteira e mae de 4 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è Operaria Agricola na  empresa de producao de banana a mais de 6 anos e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da machamba na sua casa, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com seu esposo.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, barrotes, area,cimento, varroes  e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem com   grande desafio melhor as condicoes de forma a conferir melhor conforto a familia.
texts.en: Amelia, age 42, is a single mother of four children, who all attend elementary school or high school. She has worked as an agricultural worker at a banana factory for more than six years. She and her husband also maintain an informal business in her house selling produce from their small farm. With this loan she will buy construction materials (blocks, cement, beams, gravel, rods) and pay for hired labor to continue making improvements to her house. Her main challenge is in improving her living conditions to provide a more comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, beams, gravel, rods) and pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La socia Margarita se dedica al negocio de crianza de pollos, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.L
texts.en:
Margarita makes a living breeding chickens. She fatten them and makes them grow to then sell them in different markets. She has been in the business for several years and things have gone well. Her dream is to have her own store to sell the chickens. 

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and food for them.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
A Sra. Laura de 62 anos de idade casada e mae de 9 filhos todos maiores de idade e sao independente. Ela è pensionista Militar Junto com o seu esposo.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, barrotes, varroes, janelas, prtas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mrs Laura is 62 years old, married and the mother of 9 children who are all of age and independent.  She's a military pensioner together with her husband.

This loan will be used to buy construction material (cement, beams, rods, windows, doors and to pay for labour) to continue building her house.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, beams, rods, windows, doors and to pay for labour) to continue building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, rods) and to pay for the labour to continue the building work on her home.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Carolina de 29 anos de idade, casada e mae de 5 (filhos) dos quais 4 (quatros) estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario  a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è negociante de produtos da primeira necessidade a mais de 10 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da primeira necessidade tais como: amendoim, arroz, feijao, caldo, rebucados e diversos prudutos para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu proprio estabelicimento comercial, actividade que esta ser acompanhado junto com seu esposo.
texts.en:
Mrs Carolina is 29 years old, married and a mother of 5 (five) children of whom 4 (four) go to school - primary school and high school - the other is still to young to go to school. She's a trader and has been selling essential products for more than 10 years.

With this loan she will buy essential products such as: peanuts, rice, beans, stock, sweets and various goods to increase the volume of business at her commercial establishment. She carries out her commercial activities with her husband.

loans.use: buy essential products such as: peanuts, rice, beans, stock, sweets and various goods to increase the volume of her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
O Sr. Carlos de 37 anos de idade, casado e pai  de 4 filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola, sustenta sua mae e 3 seus irmaos que vivem com ele. Ele è negocinante informal de produtos da 1ª necisssidade. 
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necissidade (farinha de milho, omo, refregerante, bebidas, massa,tomate, bolachas, rebusados e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio e fazer crescer ainda mais o seu negocio.
texts.en: Carlos, age 37, is married and the father of four children, three of whom are in elementary or high school, and one of whom is not yet school-aged. He also supports his mother and three brothers, who live with him. He is a businessman selling basic needs items. With this loan he will buy products such as corn flour, detergent, frozen goods, sodas, dough, tomatoes, crackers, and many other items in order to increase his sales. His main challenge is in continuing to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy daily need items such as corn flour, detergent, frozen goods, sodas, dough, tomatoes, and crackers.

loans.name: Kahanda Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39-year-old married man with 3 children, who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a village stall selling general merchandise and also obtains income from farming. He began the business to be able to have an alternative income to meet his family's needs and also to supply essential goods to his fellow villagers so that they will not have to travel to urban centers for these goods.

Joseph is a member of a village bank group where they guarantee each another for a loan. He hopes to expand his stall, though he mainly faces a challenge of high small capital. Joseph is requesting the loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

The photo has an extra person who is also a group member with savings and has guaranteed others but has not taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for sell.

loans.name: Veronica Ana Maria

texts.es:
Verónica, se dedica a elaborar antojitos como tostadas, yuca frita, pasteles, etc., para luego vender a sus clientes y es propietaria de una mini tienda de productos de la canasta básica, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo, el negocio fue fundado hace 5 años y es un medio para obtener ingresos que son de utilidad para cubrir gastos familiares; vive con sus hijos de 15 y 7 años de edad, disfruta mucho el ser una madre dedica a dar lo mejor a su familia.
Se ha decidido por solicitar ayuda a través de un crédito para comprar arroz, maíz, frijol, papas, yuca, aceite, etc., continuara elaborando la venta de antojitos y su tienda ofrecerá nuevos productos, espera obtener resultados positivos con la inversión, mejorar su situación económica y resarcir su deuda.
Verónica sueña con dar a sus hijos apoyo para que se superen académicamente y puedan tener un futuro prometedor en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Verónica makes snacks such as toasts, fried manioc, pastries, etc. that she sells to customers. She owns a small grocery store where she sells basic products and works everyday without a fixed schedule. She started the business 5 years ago and it has become an income source to cover household expenses. She lives with her sons, ages 15 and 7, and really enjoys being a mother and providing her family with the best. 

She has decided to request a loan to buy rice, corn, beans, potatoes, yucca, oil, etc. She plans to keep making snacks, but will also add new products to the store. She expects to obtain positive results from the investment, improve her financial situation and cancel her debt. Her goal is to give her children the support they need to succeed in school and have a promising future.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, beans, potatoes, yucca, oil, etc. to keep making snacks and to add new products to her store.

loans.name: Bubu

texts.ru: Бубу 62 года, замужем, мать героиня 9 детей, все они взрослые, все кроме младшего сына - проживают отдельно, у Бубу уже есть 24 внука. Бубу в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 1991 году начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Бубу на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 10 овец, 6 коз. Корм и сено она заготавливает сама. Доход от животноводческой деятельности составляет около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Это безусловно низкий доход и его не хватает на достойную жизнь. Поэтому, видя дополнительный источник дохода в разведении скота, Бубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Бубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что позволит увеличить доходы ее семьи.
texts.en: Bubu is 62 years old, married, and the "mother-heroine" of nine children ["mother-heroine" is an honorary title awarded for bearing and raising a large family].  All her children are now adults and all, except her youngest son, have left the home to live independently.  Bubu already has 24 grandchildren.  She started her own animal husbandry in 1991 in order to provide a source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns four cows, ten sheep and six goats.  She prepares the hay and animal feed by herself.  She makes close to 3,000 som (KGS) per month from her animal husbandry business.  This is definitely a very small income, which is not enough to provide a decent living.  Realizing that she could make more money while still raising livestock, Bubu has decided to turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy livestock.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her farming business, which will in turn enable her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase the income she makes from her business.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.pt:
O Sr Patricio de 58 anos de idade, casado e pai de 7 filhos dos quais 2 estao afrequentar a escola no ensino secundario e 5 sao independente e que se encontram na vizinha Africa do Sul, sustenta 2 irmaos seus. Ele è pensionista militar e è agricultor informal, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com a sua esposa e um dos seus filhos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (barrotes, janelas, chapas de zinco pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como desafios liquidar a dίvida no prazo pre-estabelecido e solicitar mais empréstimo, insuficiência de fundos.
texts.en: Patricio, age 58, is married and the father of seven children, two of whom attend high school and five of whom are independent and live in neighboring South Africa. He also provides for his two brothers. He is a military pensioner and also maintains a farm, where he is assisted by his wife and one of his sons. With this loan he will buy construction materials such as beams, windows, sheet metal, and stone, and pay for hired labor in order to continue making improvements to his house. His main focus is on making his payments on the pre-determined schedule so he can seek future loans, and his lack of funds.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as beams, windows, sheet metal, and stone, and to pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
A Sra Luisa de 39 anos de idade, casada  e mae de 6 filhos dos quais 5 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola, sustenta sua mae e 3 seus irmaos que vivem com ela. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade que esta a explorar no seu estabelicimento comercial junto com seus filhos na sua casa.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (farinha de milho, omo, refregerante, bebidas, massa,tomate, bolachas, rebucados e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao.
texts.en:
Mrs Luisa is 39 years old, married and the mother of 6 children; 5 of whom go to primary school or high school and a daughter who is too young to go to school. She supports her mother and 3 siblings who live with her. She's an informal trader of essential products, an activity she carries out with her children from her commercial establishment which is in her home.

This loan will be used to buy essential products (corn flour, omo detergent, sodas, drinks, pasta, tomatoes, biscuits, sweets and various other products) to increase the volume of her business.
Her biggest challenge is to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy essential products (corn flour, omo detergent, sodas, drinks, pasta, tomatoes, biscuits, sweets and various other products) to increase the volume of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy daily needs items such as corn flour, detergent, frozen goods, beverages, dough, tomatoes and crackers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una peluquería y barbería desde hace 5 años ubicada en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una nueva máquina para cortar pelo y barba, un espejo y una silla, ya que tiene mucha demanda y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man’s face is blurred because he is 28 and lives in a high-risk area
